language.p: Pada hari ini juga, pukul 26 pagi (310 M), dua uskup Koptik Pilus dan Nylios, bersama dengan imam Elia, dan salah satu pemimpin awam, menjadi martir.

text.language: وفيه أيضاً من سنة 26 للشهداء (31٠ م) استشهد الأسقفان القبطيان بيليوس ونيلوس ومعهما إيليا الكاهن وواحد من الأراخنة.

They were exiled in Palestine and were working there in a quarry. With the help of some of the natives they were able to build some churches. When Vamlian the Governor, knew that, he sent to Emperor Galerius to inform him of their conduct. The Emperor ordered to torture them. The Governor sent these four to Petra in the land of Palestine. They threw them into the fire and were burned, so they received the crown of martyrdom.

language.p: Mereka diasingkan ke Palestina dan bekerja di sana di sebuah pertambangan. Dengan bantuan beberapa penduduk asli lokal, mereka mampu membangun beberapa gereja. Ketika Vamlian sang Gubernur mengetahui hal itu, ia mengirim utusan kepada Kaisar Galerius untuk memberitahunya tentang perilaku mereka. Kaisar memerintahkan untuk menyiksa mereka. Gubernur mengirim keempat orang ini ke Petra di tanah Palestina. Mereka melemparkan mereka ke dalam api dan dibakar, sehingga mereka menerima mahkota kemartiran.

text.language: وذلك أنهم كانوا منفيين إلى بلاد فلسطين وكانوا هناك يعملون فى محاجر. فتمكنوا مع آخرين من مواطنيهم أن يبنوا بعض الكنائس. ولما علم الوالى فامليان بذلك أرسل إلى الملك جالريوس يخبره بذلك. فأمر الملك بتعذيبهم. فأرسل الوالى هؤلاء الأربعة إلى فينون فى بترا ببلاد فلسطين. حيث ألقوهم فى النيران فاحترقوا جميعاً ونالوا إكاليل الشهادة.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.

language.span: Berkat doa mereka menyertai kita semua dan kemuliaan bagi Tuhan kita selamanya. Amin.

text.language: بركة صلواتهم فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Tenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Tenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم العاشر من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the tenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

b.span: Hari Kesepuluh Bulan Tut yang penuh berkah

language.span: Hari ini adalah hari kesepuluh bulan Tut yang penuh berkah. Semoga Tuhan mengawalinya dengan kebaikan dan memperbaruinya bagi kita dalam kedamaian dan ketenangan, serta dosa dan kesalahan kita diampuni melalui belas kasihan Tuhan kita, wahai para bapa beserta ibu dan saudara-saudariku. Amin.

text.language: اليوم العاشر من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إستقباله، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of Sts. Youannes the Egyptian and his companions

language.p: Kemartiran St. Youannes dari Mesir dan para sahabatnya

Title.language: إستشهاد القديس يوأنس المصرى

text.language: On this day, the Sts. Youannes and his twenty friends were martyred. That was during the reign of Emperor Maximinus Daza who ruled from the year 305 to 313 A.D.

language.p: Pada hari ini, St. Youannes dan dua puluh sahabatnya menjadi martir. Itu terjadi pada masa pemerintahan Kaisar Maximinus Daza yang memerintah dari tahun 305 hingga 313 M.

text.language: فى مثل هذا اليوم استشهد القديس يوأنس المصرى وزملاؤه العشرين وذلك فى عهد الإمبراطور مكسيميانوس الذى حكم ما بين سنة 305 إلى سنة 313م.

This saint loved the Lord from all his heart and he memorized the Holy Scripture until it was imprinted deep in his soul. He met with Eusebius of Caesarea, the father of church History, who was amazed from Youannes’ vast knowledge of the Holy Book.

language.p: Orang suci ini mencintai Tuhan dengan sepenuh hatinya dan menghafal Kitab Suci hingga tertanam dalam jiwanya. Ia bertemu dengan Eusebius dari Kaisarea, bapa Sejarah Gereja, yang kagum dengan pengetahuan luas Youannes tentang Kitab Suci.

text.language: كان هذا القديس يحب الرب من كل قلبه ويحفظ الأسفار الإلهية حتى إنطبعت فى أعماقه. وقد تقابل معه يوسابيوس القيصرى أبو التاريخ الكنسى فدُهش من معرفته الواسعة للكتاب المقدس.

This saint confessed, along with his companions, the Lord Christ before the Governor, who ordered to send them for hard labor under the scourging sun. The Governor ordered to pluck out St. Youannes’ eyes and to burn one of his legs with red hot iron. Finally, ordered to behead them all, so they received the crowns of martyrdom.

language.p: Orang suci ini mengaku, bersama para sahabatnya, Tuhan Kristus di hadapan Gubernur, yang memerintahkan untuk mengirim mereka bekerja keras di bawah terik matahari. Gubernur memerintahkan untuk mencungkil mata St. Youannes dan membakar salah satu kakinya dengan besi panas membara. Akhirnya, memerintahkan untuk memenggal kepala mereka semua, sehingga mereka menerima mahkota kemartiran.

text.language: وقد إعترف هذا القديس مع زملائه العشرين بالسيد المسيح أمام الوالى. فأمر بارسالهم ليعملوا فى أشغال شاقة تحت لهيب الشمس المحرقة ، أما القديس يوأنس فأمر الوالى بقلع عينيه وحرق إحدى ساقيه بالحديد المحُمى بالنار. وأخيرا ً أمر بقطع رؤوسهم جميعاً فنالوا أكاليل الشهادة.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all. Amen.

language.span: Berkat doa mereka menyertai kita semua. Amin.

text.language: بركة صلواتهم فلتكن معنا. أمين .

Title.language: The Martyrdom of Saint Matruna
إستشهاد القديسة مطرونة

text.language: Also on this day, St. Matruna was martyred. She was raised in a Christian home. When she grew up, life forced her to work as a maid-servant in a home of a Jewish lady. Her mistress used to entice her to adopt the Jewish religion. Matruna did not yield to her pressure. Therefore, her mistress used to humiliate her, ill-treat her, and over-burden her with servitude. One day she imprisoned her in a dark room where she spent four days without food or drink. She then took her out and beat her painfully, and then she returned her back to her imprisonment where she died. Therefore, she received the crown of martyrdom for her steadfast in her faith.

language.p: Pada hari ini juga, Santa Matruna menjadi martir. Ia dibesarkan di rumah tangga Kristen. Ketika ia tumbuh dewasa, kehidupan memaksanya untuk bekerja sebagai pembantu di rumah seorang wanita Yahudi. Nyonyanya selalu membujuknya untuk memeluk agama Yahudi. Matruna tidak menyerah pada tekanannya. Oleh karena itu, majikannya selalu mempermalukannya, menganiayanya, dan membebaninya dengan perbudakan. Suatu hari, ia memenjarakannya di sebuah ruangan gelap dan menghabiskan empat hari tanpa makan dan minum. Ia kemudian membawanya keluar dan memukulinya dengan menyakitkan, lalu mengembalikannya ke penjara dan meninggal. Oleh karena itu, ia menerima mahkota kemartiran atas keteguhan imannya.

text.language: وفيه أيضا ً إستشهدت القديسة مطرونة. وقد نشأت هذه القديسة فى بيت مسيحى ولما كبرت إضطرتها الحياة أن تعمل كخادمة فى بيت امرأة يهودية. وكانت سيدتها تغُريها على أعتناق الديانة اليهودية، ولم تكن مطرونة تستمع إلى مشورتها الرديئة. لذلك كثيرا ما كانت هذه السيدة تهينها وتثقل عليها الخدمة وتضربها. وفى أحد الأيام حبستها فى غرفة مظلمة وتركتها أربعة أيام بدون طعام أوشراب. ثم أخرجتها وضربتها وأعادتها للحبس مرة أخرى فتنيحت فيه. ونالت إكليل الشهادة لأجل تمسكها بايمانها المسيحي.
The blessing of her prayers be with us all. Amen.

language.span: Semoga doa-doanya diberkati untuk kita semua. Amin.

text.language: بركة صلواتها فلتكن معنا أمين .

Title.language: The Commemoration of Sts. Basin and Her Three Children

b.span: Peringatan St. Basin dan Ketiga Anaknya

Title.language: تذكار إستشهاد القديسة باسين وأولادها الثلاثة

text.language: On this day also the church celebrates the commemoration of St. Basin and her three children.

language.p: Pada hari ini juga gereja merayakan peringatan St. Basin dan ketiga anaknya.

text.language: وفى مثل هذا اليوم تعيد الكنيسة بتذكار أستشهاد القديسة باسين وأولادها الثلاثة.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.

language.span: Semoga doa mereka menyertai kita semua dan kemuliaan bagi Tuhan kita selamanya. Amin.

text.language: بركة صلواتهم فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين.

Title.language: The Eleventh Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
Hari Kesebelas Bulan Tut yang Penuh Berkah
اليوم الحادى عشر من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the eleventh day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Hari ini adalah hari kesebelas bulan Tut yang penuh berkah. Semoga Tuhan mengawalinya dengan kebaikan dan memperbaruinya bagi kita dalam kedamaian dan ketenangan, serta dosa-dosa dan kesalahan kita diampuni melalui belas kasihan Tuhan kita, wahai para bapa beserta ibu dan saudara-saudariku. Amin.
اليوم الحادى عشر من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إستقباله، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of Saint Basilides (Wasilides), the Minister
Kemartiran Santo Basilides (Wasilides), Sang Menteri
إستشهاد القديس واسيليدس الوزير

text.language: On this day, St. Basilides (Wasilides), who was a member of the cabinet and a counselor during the reign of Emperor Numerianus, was martyred. Numerianus married Basilides’ sister. Basilides had two sons, Eusabius and Macarius. When the Persians waged war against Rome, Emperor Numerianus (Numerian) sent his son Yustus to fight them.

Pada hari ini, Santo Basilides (Wasilides), yang merupakan anggota kabinet dan penasihat pada masa pemerintahan Kaisar Numerianus, menjadi martir. Numerianus menikahi saudara perempuan Basilides. Basilides memiliki dua putra, Eusabius dan Macarius. Ketika Persia berperang melawan Roma, Kaisar Numerianus (Numerian) mengirim putranya Yustus untuk melawan mereka.

فى مثل هذا اليوم استشهد القديس واسيليدس. وكان هذا القديس وزيراً فى عهد الملك نوماريوس الذى تزوج أخت واسيليدس. وكان لواسيليدس إبنان هما يوسابيوس ومكاريوس ، ولما ثار الفرس على الروم أرسل الملك نوماريوس إبنه يسطس لمقاتلة الفرس.

Emperor Numerianus was killed by his in-law Arrius Aper. Diocletian, who was Emperor Numerianus’ servant, rose up and killed Arrius. The soldiers rallied around Diocletian and proclaimed him Emperor in Antioch in the year 284 A.D.

Kaisar Numerianus dibunuh oleh mertuanya Arrius Aper. Diocletian, yang merupakan pelayan Kaisar Numerianus, bangkit dan membunuh Arrius. Para prajurit berkumpul di sekitar Diocletian dan mengangkatnya sebagai Kaisar di Antiokhia pada tahun 284 M.
أما الملك نوماريوس فقتله صهره آيروس. فقام دقلديانوس خادم الملك نوماريوس وقتل آيروس ، فالتف الجنود حوله وأقاموه ملكاً فى أنطاكية سنة (284م).

After a while, Diocletian renounced the Lord Christ and worshipped the idols. On the 23rd of February, year 303 A.D., he issued his edict to persecute the Christians. He started by eliminating the royal family. He sent Basilides to Masrus, the governor of the Five Western Cities (Pentapolis). He tortured him severely, once with the Hinbazeen , and other time by placing him in a cauldron filled with boiling oil. Then he was lifted up on a spiral device with an iron saw, and the governor did not leave out any means of torturing him.

Setelah beberapa lama, Diokletianus meninggalkan Tuhan Kristus dan menyembah berhala. Pada tanggal 23 Februari tahun 303 M, ia mengeluarkan dekritnya untuk menganiaya orang-orang Kristen. Ia memulainya dengan melenyapkan keluarga kerajaan. Ia mengirim Basilides ke Masrus, gubernur Lima Kota Barat (Pentapolis). Ia menyiksanya dengan kejam, sekali dengan Hinbazeen, dan di waktu lain dengan menempatkannya di dalam kuali berisi minyak mendidih. Kemudian ia diangkat dengan alat spiral dengan gergaji besi, dan gubernur tidak mengabaikan cara apa pun untuk menyiksanya.

وبعد فترة كفَّر بالمسيح وعبد الأوثان وأصدر منشورا ًبإضطهاد المسيحيين فى 23 فبراير سنة (303م) وبدأ بقتل أفراد العائلة المالكة. فأرسل واسيليدس إلى ماسورس والى الخمس مدن الغربية الذى عذبه عذاباً شديداً ، تارة بالهنبازين (آلة عبارة عن دولاب به أسنان من حديد لتمشيط الجسم) ، وتارة بوضعه فى خلقين (إناء ضخم من النحاس يغلى فيه زيت أو قار) ثم رفعه على لولب به منشار حديد. ولم يترك شيئا ً من أنواع العذاب إلا وعذبه به.
When Masrus saw that Basilides remained steadfast in his faith in the Lord Christ, he ordered him beheaded, so he received the crown of martyrdom.
Ketika Masrus melihat bahwa Basilides tetap teguh dalam imannya kepada Tuhan Yesus Kristus, ia memerintahkan agar ia dipenggal, sehingga ia menerima mahkota kemartiran.
ولما رآه ثابتا ً كالصخر على إيمانه بالسيد المسيح ، أخيراً أمر بقطع رأسه فنال إكليل الشهادة.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
Semoga berkat doanya menyertai kita semua. Amin.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا. أمين .

Title.language: The Martyrdom of the Three Farmers in Esna
Kesyahidan Tiga Petani di Esna
إستشهاد الثلاثة فلاحين في مدينة إسنا

text.language: On this day also, the three saintly farmers (Fallahin) in Esna were martyred. They were Sorus, Antokion, and Mash-hory.
Pada hari ini juga, tiga petani suci (Fallahin) di Esna menjadi martir. Mereka adalah Sorus, Antokion, dan Mash-hory.
وفيه أيضا ً إستشهد القديسون الثلاثة الفلاحون بـإسنا وهم سورس وأنطوكيون ومشهورى.

Now, after the martyrdom of the people of Esna, Arianus, the governor, took Anba Ammonius , bishop of Esna, a prisoner with him to Aswan and on his way back he entered the city and found no one there.

Setelah kesyahidan orang-orang Esna, Arianus, sang gubernur, membawa Anba Ammonius, uskup Esna, seorang tahanan bersamanya ke Aswan dan dalam perjalanan pulang, ia memasuki kota dan tidak menemukan seorang pun di sana.
وذلك أنه بعد إستشهاد شعب إسنا ، أخذ الوالى إريانوس الأنبا أمونيوس أسقف إسنا أسيرا ًمعه إلى أسوان وعند رجوعه دخل مدينة إسنا فلم يجد فيها أحدا ً.

He went to the northern part of the city where he met these three farmers. They cried out with one accord saying, “We are Christians.” The governor replied, “Our swords are dull from much use.” So the men said, “We have our axes, kill us with them.” He ordered the soldiers to slay them. There was a big rock, the men put their necks on it and the soldiers beheaded them with their own axes accordingly they received the crowns of martyrdom.

Ia pergi ke bagian utara kota dan bertemu dengan ketiga petani itu. Mereka berseru serempak, “Kami adalah orang Kristen.” Gubernur itu menjawab, “Pedang-pedang kami sudah tumpul karena sering digunakan.” Lalu orang-orang itu berkata, “Kami punya kapak, bunuhlah kami dengan kapak itu.” Ia memerintahkan para prajurit untuk membunuh mereka. Ada sebuah batu besar, orang-orang meletakkan leher mereka di atasnya dan para prajurit memenggal kepala mereka dengan kapak mereka sendiri sehingga mereka menerima mahkota kemartiran.

وسار إلى بحرى المدينة فقابله هؤلاء الفلاحون الثلاثة فصرخوا بصوت واحد نحن مسيحيون. فأجاب الوالى لقد أرجعنا سيوفنا إلى أغمادها. فقالوا معنا فؤوسنا إقتلنا بها فأمر الوالى الجند بقتلهم وكان هناك حجر كبير.
Their bodies are buried in their special splendid shrine in their church in the middle of the city of Esna, where prayers and venerations are celebrated on their feast day.
Jenazah mereka dikuburkan di tempat khusus yang megah di gereja mereka di tengah kota Esna, di mana doa-doa dan pemujaan dirayakan pada hari raya mereka.
مازالت أجسادهم مدفونة فى وسط مدينة إسنا فى مقبرة كبيرة خاصة بهم ، تقام بها الصلوات فى أعيادهم.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
Berkat dari doa-doa mereka menyertai kita semua dan kemuliaan bagi Allah kita selamanya. Amin.
بركة صلواتهم فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Twelfth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Twelfth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الثانى عشر من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the twelfth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the twelfth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الثانى عشر من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إستقباله، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Commemoration of the Archangel Michael
The Commemoration of the Archangel Michael
تذكار رئيس الملائكة الجليل ميخائيل

text.language: On this day, the church celebrates the monthly commemoration of the pure Archangel Michael, the head of the heavenly hosts.
On this day, the church celebrates the monthly commemoration of the pure Archangel Michael, the head of the heavenly hosts.
فى مثل هذا اليوم تعيد الكنيسة بالتذكار الشهرى لرئيس الملائكة الطاهر ميخائيل رئيس جند الرب.
His holy intercession be with us all. Amen
His holy intercession be with us all. Amen
بركة شفاعته المقدسة فلتكن معنا أمين.

Title.language: The Commemoration of the Assembly of the Third Ecumenical Council at Ephesus
The Commemoration of the Assembly of the Third Ecumenical Council at Ephesus
تذكار أنعقاد المجمع المسكونى بأفسس

text.language: On this day of the year 147 A.M. (431 A.D.), the Ecumenical Council was convened at the city of Ephesus, in Asia Minor, which was attended by 200 bishops. Emperor Theodosius II, convened this council to examine the heresy of Nestorius, Archbishop of Constantinople. He believed that “St. Mary did not give birth to the incarnate God, but only to a human being, and that afterwards the Son of God dwelt in him, not the dwelling of unity but just the dwelling of will, and therefore, the Lord Christ because of that reason, had two natures and two wills. Therefore it was not proper to call the Virgin, the Mother of God.”

On this day of the year 147 A.M. (431 A.D.), the Ecumenical Council was convened at the city of Ephesus, in Asia Minor, which was attended by 200 bishops. Emperor Theodosius II, convened this council to examine the heresy of Nestorius, Archbishop of Constantinople. He believed that “St. Mary did not give birth to the incarnate God, but only to a human being, and that afterwards the Son of God dwelt in him, not the dwelling of unity but just the dwelling of will, and therefore, the Lord Christ because of that reason, had two natures and two wills. Therefore it was not proper to call the Virgin, the Mother of God.”

وفى مثل هذا اليوم أيضاً من سنة 147 للشهداء (431 م) أنعقد المجمع المسكونى بمدينة أفسس بآسيا الصغرى من مائتى أسقف بأمر الإمبراطور ثيؤدوسيوس الصغير للنظر فى بدعة نسطور أسقف القسطنطينية. الذى قال (إن القديسة مريم لم تلد إلها ً متجسدا ً بل إنساناً عادياً حل فيه بعد ذلك ابن الله حلول المشيئة والإرادة لا حلول الاتحاد وإن للسيد المسيح طبيعتين وأقنومين). ولذلك قال أنه لا يجوز تسمية العذراء والدة الإله.

Because of this alarming and serious heresy this council convened presided by St. Cyril I, Pillar of Faith, the 24th Patriarch of Alexandria. He was accompanied by fifty Egyptian bishops, the saint Anba Shenouda, the Archimandrite, the saint Anba Victor, the head of the monasteries of Anba Pachomius, the father of the Koinonia, and St. Dioscorus, the dean of the Theological School of Alexandria and the secretary of the Pope.

Because of this alarming and serious heresy this council convened presided by St. Cyril I, Pillar of Faith, the 24th Patriarch of Alexandria. He was accompanied by fifty Egyptian bishops, the saint Anba Shenouda, the Archimandrite, the saint Anba Victor, the head of the monasteries of Anba Pachomius, the father of the Koinonia, and St. Dioscorus, the dean of the Theological School of Alexandria and the secretary of the Pope.

ومن أجل هذه البدعة الخطيرة إجتمع هذا المجمع برئاسة البابا القديس كيرلس الأول عمود الدين بطريرك الإسكندرية الرابع والعشرين ومعه خمسون أسقفاً مصرياً والقديس الأنبا شنودة رئيس المتوحدين والقديس الأنبا بقطر رئيس أديرة الأنبا باخوميوس أب الشركة والقديس ديسقوروس مدير مدرسة الإسكندرية اللاهوتية وسكرتير البابا.

Nestorius tried to hamper the assembling of this council but finally he had to attend along with some of his bishops surrounded by armed men to intimidate the council. When Pope Cyril and the members of the council asked him about his beliefs, he replied saying; “The Virgin Mary had given birth to an ordinary man and did not give birth to the incarnate God.” Those were assembled tried to convince him to abandon his erroneous belief. When he insisted on his blasphemy, the council judged to depose him and exile him from his See. They excommunicated everyone who believes in his doctrine. The Emperor exiled him to Akhmeem in Upper Egypt, where he died a horrible death.

Nestorius tried to hamper the assembling of this council but finally he had to attend along with some of his bishops surrounded by armed men to intimidate the council. When Pope Cyril and the members of the council asked him about his beliefs, he replied saying; “The Virgin Mary had given birth to an ordinary man and did not give birth to the incarnate God.” Those were assembled tried to convince him to abandon his erroneous belief. When he insisted on his blasphemy, the council judged to depose him and exile him from his See. They excommunicated everyone who believes in his doctrine. The Emperor exiled him to Akhmeem in Upper Egypt, where he died a horrible death.

وقد حاول نسطور أن يعطل انعقاد المجمع ولكنه أخيراً أضُطر للحضور ومعه بعض أساقفة ويحيط به رجال مسلحون لإرهاب المجمع. ولما سأله البابا كيرلس وأعضاء المجمع عن تعاليمه المخالفة رد قائلا ً : ( إن العذراء مريم ولدت إنساناً محضاً ولم تلد الإله المتأنس) ولما حاول المجتمعون أن يردوه عن رأيه الفاسد تمسك بكفره فحكم المجمع بقطعه وإبعاده عن كرسيه وحرم كل من يعتقد باعتقاده. ثم نفاه الإمبراطور إلى أخميم بصعيد مصر حيث مات أشر ميتة.

The Council confirmed that the Virgin is the mother of the Incarnate Word of God (Theotokos) . They also laid down the Introduction to the Creed “We exalt you, the Mother of the true Light …” and also eight ecclesiastical canons.

The Council confirmed that the Virgin is the mother of the Incarnate Word of God (Theotokos) . They also laid down the Introduction to the Creed “We exalt you, the Mother of the true Light …” and also eight ecclesiastical canons.
ثم كتب الآباء مقدمة قانون الإيمان وهي (نعظمك يا أم النور الحقيقى) وأيضاً وضعوا ثمانية قوانين كنسية أخرى .

Also the other reason for the assembly of this council was the heresy of Pelagius who said; “Adam’s sin harmed only himself, not the human race, and every child just born is in the same state as Adam before his fall, and he can attain moral perfection through human free will and personal natural struggle.”

Also the other reason for the assembly of this council was the heresy of Pelagius who said; “Adam’s sin harmed only himself, not the human race, and every child just born is in the same state as Adam before his fall, and he can attain moral perfection through human free will and personal natural struggle.”

ومن أسباب إنعقاد هذا المجمع أيضاً بدعة بيلاجيوس الذى كان يقول: أن خطية آدم كانت قاصرة عليه وحده ولم تتسرب إلى نسله من بعده ومن ثم فكل إنسان يولد يكون كآدم قبل الخطية ويمكنه أن يبلغ أسمى درجات القداسة بجهاده الطبيعى وحريته الشخصية.

After the council had discussed the heretical teachings of Pelagius and revealed the invalidity of his doctrine, the council excommunicated him. The fathers in the council explained that the human cannot be perfected without the grace of salvation through the redeeming work of the blood of Christ which was shed on the wood of the Cross.

After the council had discussed the heretical teachings of Pelagius and revealed the invalidity of his doctrine, the council excommunicated him. The fathers in the council explained that the human cannot be perfected without the grace of salvation through the redeeming work of the blood of Christ which was shed on the wood of the Cross.
وبعد أن ناقش المجمع بيلاجيوس المبتدع وأظهر بطلان تعاليمه حرمه المجمع كما بين المجمع أن الإنسان لا يكون كاملاً إلا بنعمة الخلاص التي بالفداء بدم السيد المسيح المسفوك على عود الصليب.
The blessing of the prayers of the fathers of this council be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of the prayers of the fathers of this council be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلوات آباء هذا المجمع فلتكن معنا. أمين .

Title.language: The Translocation of the relics of Sts. Clemus (Aklimos) and his companions
The Translocation of the relics of Sts. Clemus (Aklimos) and his companions
تذكار نقل أعضاء الشهداء إقليمس وأصحابه إلى مدينة الإسكندرية

text.language: Also on this day the church celebrate the translocation of the relics of the martyrs St. Clemus (Aklimos) and his companions to the city of Alexandria.
Also on this day the church celebrate the translocation of the relics of the martyrs St. Clemus (Aklimos) and his companions to the city of Alexandria.
وفيه أيضاً تُعيد الكنيسة بتذكار نقل أعضاء الشهداء إقليمس وأصحابه الى مدينة الإسكندرية.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
بركة صلواتهم فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Thirteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Thirteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الثالث عشر من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the thirteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the thirteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الثالث عشر من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إستقباله، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Commemoration of the Miracle performed by St. Basilius (Basil) the Great, Bishop of Caesarea, Cappadocia
The Commemoration of the Miracle performed by St. Basilius (Basil) the Great, Bishop of Caesarea, Cappadocia
تذكار الأعجوبة التى صنعها القديس باسيليوس الكبير أسقف قيصارية الكبادوك

text.language: On this day, is the commemoration of the miracle performed by St. Basilius the great, Bishop of Caesarea, Cappadocia.
On this day, is the commemoration of the miracle performed by St. Basilius the great, Bishop of Caesarea, Cappadocia.
فى هذا اليوم تذكار الأعجوبة التى تمت على يد القديس باسيليوس الكبير.

A young man from the city of Caesarea loved his master's daughter. When his marriage to her was impossible, he resorted to a magician who wrote for him a covenant and asked him to go in the middle of night to the unbelievers’ cemetery and to raise his hand holding the paper so the devil would snatch it from his hand. He asked him to deny the faith in the Lord Christ if he received his wish. This wretched young man agreed to that. Shortly after, Satan granted him his wish by kindling lust in the heart of the girl. She asked her father insistently not to object to her marriage to that young man. Eager for his honor and fearing for her life, he gave her in marriage to him.

A young man from the city of Caesarea loved his master's daughter. When his marriage to her was impossible, he resorted to a magician who wrote for him a covenant and asked him to go in the middle of night to the unbelievers’ cemetery and to raise his hand holding the paper so the devil would snatch it from his hand. He asked him to deny the faith in the Lord Christ if he received his wish. This wretched young man agreed to that. Shortly after, Satan granted him his wish by kindling lust in the heart of the girl. She asked her father insistently not to object to her marriage to that young man. Eager for his honor and fearing for her life, he gave her in marriage to him.

حيث أن شابا ً بمدينة قيصرية أحب إبنة سيده. ولما كان زواجه منها مستحيلاً لجأ إلى أحد السحرة فكتب له ورقة وأمره أن يذهب فى منتصف الليل إلى قبور غير المؤمنين ، ويرفع يده بالورقة فيتناولها منه الشيطان وطلب منه أن يكفر بالمسيح إذا نال أمنيته. فوافقه هذا الشاب المسكين على ذلك. وبعد ذلك تمم له الشيطان ماقصده بأن ألهب قلب الشابة بهواه حتى تزوجته.

Because of the prayers of her parents, God removed the blinds from her heart and mind and she realized that this young man is not Christian for he does not practice any of the Christian rituals. She was very sorrowful for what she had done, and asked him for the reason; he told her all what had happened to him.

Because of the prayers of her parents, God removed the blinds from her heart and mind and she realized that this young man is not Christian for he does not practice any of the Christian rituals. She was very sorrowful for what she had done, and asked him for the reason; he told her all what had happened to him.
وبصلوات والديها كشف الله الغشاوة عن عقلها وعرفت أن ذلك الشاب غير مسيحى لأنه لا يمارس أى عبادة مسيحية فندمت على ما فعلت. ولما سألته عن السبب صارحها بكل مافعله.

Immediately she went to St. Basilius, and told him what had happened and asked him to help her. He brought the young man and asked him if he wish to repent on his evil deed and come back to the Lord Christ. The young man consented. St. Basilius kept him for three days during which he asked him to fast and pray. On the third day St. Basilius visited him and the young man told him that the evil spirits had not ceased disturbing him and threatened him with the deed that he wrote against himself. The Bishop strengthened him and prayed for him. The young man remained there for forty days in prayers. Then St. Basil visited him and asked him about his well-being, he told the Saint; that he saw him that night fighting against Satan on his behalf, and he vanquished him.

Immediately she went to St. Basilius, and told him what had happened and asked him to help her. He brought the young man and asked him if he wish to repent on his evil deed and come back to the Lord Christ. The young man consented. St. Basilius kept him for three days during which he asked him to fast and pray. On the third day St. Basilius visited him and the young man told him that the evil spirits had not ceased disturbing him and threatened him with the deed that he wrote against himself. The Bishop strengthened him and prayed for him. The young man remained there for forty days in prayers. Then St. Basil visited him and asked him about his well-being, he told the Saint; that he saw him that night fighting against Satan on his behalf, and he vanquished him.

فأسرعت الفتاة إلى القديس باسيليوس وقصت عليه قصتها وطلبت منه نجدتها. فأستحضر الشاب وسأله إن كان يريد أن يتوب عن هذا الفعل الردئ ويرجع إلى السيد المسيح فوافق. فأستبقاه عنده لمدة ثلاثة أيام وأمره أن يصلى خلالها. وبعدها إفتقده فأعلمه الشاب أنه يرى شياطين كثيرة تهدده بذلك الصك الذى كتبه على نفسه فشجعه. وظل الشاب فى مكانه أربعين يوماً وهو يصلى. ثم بعدها أفتقده القديس باسيليوس وسأله عن حاله فأعلمه الشاب أنه رآه فى تلك الليلة يقاتل عنه الشيطان وقد غلبه.

Next day St. Basil gathered all the Christian people to the church and asked them to cry to God saying; "Lord have mercy." They continued to cry out until that writing, which the young man had written as a covenant to deny the faith and to surrender to Satan, fell down in the midst of all the people. St. Basil took this handwriting and read it to them. St. Basil blessed the young man and commanded him not to do that again, then gave him the Holy Mysteries. He returned him to his wife and blessed them.

Next day St. Basil gathered all the Christian people to the church and asked them to cry to God saying; "Lord have mercy." They continued to cry out until that writing, which the young man had written as a covenant to deny the faith and to surrender to Satan, fell down in the midst of all the people. St. Basil took this handwriting and read it to them. St. Basil blessed the young man and commanded him not to do that again, then gave him the Holy Mysteries. He returned him to his wife and blessed them.

وفى الغد أحضر القديس باسيليوس الشعب المسيحى إلى الكنيسة وطلب إليهم أن يصرخوا جميعاً إلى الله قائلين: يارب ارحم. وإستمروا فى صراخهم حتى رأوا ورقة تسقط من فوق وكانت هى الصك الذى أخده الشيطان على ذلك الشاب. فتناول القديس باسيليوس هذا الصك وقرأه على الشعب ثم بارك على الشاب. وأمره ألا يعود إلى ذلك مرة أخرى ثم ناوله من الأسرار المقدسة وأعاده إلى زوجته وبارك عليهما.
The blessing of the prayers of St. Basil be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of the prayers of St. Basil be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلاة القديس باسيليوس فلتكن معنا. أمين .

Title.language: The Departure of Pope Mettaos II (Matthew II), 90th Patriarch of the See of St. Mark
The Departure of Pope Mettaos II (Matthew II), 90th Patriarch of the See of St. Mark
نياحة البابا متاؤس الثانى البطريرك التسعين من بطاركة الكرازة المرقسية

text.language: On this day also of the year 1182 of martyrs, (1465 A.D.) the honored father Pope Mettaos II (Matthew), 90th Pope of the See of St. Mark, departed.
On this day also of the year 1182 of martyrs, (1465 A.D.) the honored father Pope Mettaos II (Matthew), 90th Pope of the See of St. Mark, departed.
وفي هذا اليوم أيضاً نياحة البابا متاؤس الثانى البطريرك التسعين من بطاركة الكرازة المرقسية.

He was a monk in the monastery of St. Mary known as El-Muharraq monastery, and his name was “Matta El-Sa-eidy”. When Pope Youannes (John) XI, the 89th Patriarch, departed, the Holy Synod met with the notable leaders of the people and agreed on choosing him for the patriarchal throne. They consecrated him Patriarch by the name of Mettaos II on the 13th day of Tute, 1169 A.M. (1452 A.D.). That was during the days of Sultan Fakhr-El-Deen Othman who had a cordial relationship with the Pope.

He was a monk in the monastery of St. Mary known as El-Muharraq monastery, and his name was “Matta El-Sa-eidy”. When Pope Youannes (John) XI, the 89th Patriarch, departed, the Holy Synod met with the notable leaders of the people and agreed on choosing him for the patriarchal throne. They consecrated him Patriarch by the name of Mettaos II on the 13th day of Tute, 1169 A.M. (1452 A.D.). That was during the days of Sultan Fakhr-El-Deen Othman who had a cordial relationship with the Pope.

كان هذا البابا راهبا ً بدير القديسة العذراء الشهير بالمحرق باسم (متى الصعيدى) ولما تنيح البابا يوأنس الحادى عشر البطريرك التاسع والثمانون إجتمع المجمع المقدس مع أراخنة الشعب وإتفقوا على إختياره لكرسى البطريركية. فرسموه بطريركاً باسم الأنبا متاؤس الثانى يوم 13 توت سنة 1169 للشهداء الموافق ( 1452 م ). وذلك فى أيام السلطان فخر الدين عثمان الذى كانت تربطه به مودة كبيرة.

This Pope, as his predecessors, resided in the antiquated church of St. Mary in Haret Zee-wai-lah, in Old Cairo. He ordained a metropolitan for Ethiopia by the name of Anba Gabriel. He also, made the Holy Myron in the church of the Holy Virgin in Haret El-Roum, in Cairo along with six bishops.

This Pope, as his predecessors, resided in the antiquated church of St. Mary in Haret Zee-wai-lah, in Old Cairo. He ordained a metropolitan for Ethiopia by the name of Anba Gabriel. He also, made the Holy Myron in the church of the Holy Virgin in Haret El-Roum, in Cairo along with six bishops.

وقد أقام هذا البابا كأسلافه بكنيسة القديسة العذراء الأثرية بحارة زويلة بالقاهرة. وفي أيامه قام برسامة مطراناً خاص للحبشة باسم الأنبا غبريال. وكذلك عمل الميرون المقدس بكنيسة القديسة العذراء بحارة الروم بالقاهرة مع ستة من الأساقفة.

He sat on the throne of St. Mark for 13 years and it was all in peace and tranquility. After he finished his endeavor departed in peace and was buried in Dair El-Khandaq nowadays known as Dair El-Anba-Rewis.

He sat on the throne of St. Mark for 13 years and it was all in peace and tranquility. After he finished his endeavor departed in peace and was buried in Dair El-Khandaq nowadays known as Dair El-Anba-Rewis.
وقد جلس هذا البابا على الكرسى المرقسى مدة ثلاث عشرة سنة كانت كلها سلام وهدوء. وبعد أن أكمل جهاده تنيح بسلام ودفن بدير الخندق المعروف حالياً بدير الأنبا رويس.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين.

Title.language: The Fourteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Fourteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الرابع عشر من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the fourteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the fourteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الرابع عشر من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إستقباله، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Agathon the Stylite
The Departure of St. Agathon the Stylite
نياحة القديس أغاثون العمودى

text.language: On this day, of the year 444 of the martyrs (728 A.D.), the Holy Father Agathon the Stylite, departed. This saint was from the city of Tinnis . His father’s name was Matra and his mother's name was Mariam. They were righteous, feared God, and loved to be charitable. This saint grew up loving God, and he was inclined to the monastic life. Nevertheless, when he was 35 years old, he was ordained a priest. He devoted himself to serve the holy church, in perpetual prayers by day and night. He served the people of God with all love and sincerity.

On this day, of the year 444 of the martyrs (728 A.D.), the Holy Father Agathon the Stylite, departed. This saint was from the city of Tinnis . His father’s name was Matra and his mother's name was Mariam. They were righteous, feared God, and loved to be charitable. This saint grew up loving God, and he was inclined to the monastic life. Nevertheless, when he was 35 years old, he was ordained a priest. He devoted himself to serve the holy church, in perpetual prayers by day and night. He served the people of God with all love and sincerity.

فى مثل هذا اليوم من سنة 444 للشهداء (728م) تنيح الأب القديس أغاثون العمودى. وقد كان هذا القديس من مدينة تانيس ( وهي مدينة مصرية قديمة كانت تسمى صوعن - ذكرها إشعياء النبى 30 : 4 - وحزقيال النبى 30 : 14 ثم صار إسمها تانيس ثم تغير إلى صا الحجر وهى موجودة اليوم فى محافظة الشرقية) وكان أبوه يسمى مطرا وأمه تدُعى مريم وكانا قديسين محبين للعطاء. فشب هذا القديس محبا ً لله. وكان يميل إلى حياة الرهبنة ولكنه رُسم قساً فلازم البيعة مداوماً على الصلوات نهارا ً وليلاً. وكان يخدم شعب الله بكل محبة وأمانة.

He asked the Lord Christ to facilitate for him the parting from this world to go to the desert. The Lord Christ answered his request and the angel of the Lord appeared to him in the form of a monk who journeyed with him to the wilderness and brought him to the monastery of St. Macarius, the great, in Scete.

He asked the Lord Christ to facilitate for him the parting from this world to go to the desert. The Lord Christ answered his request and the angel of the Lord appeared to him in the form of a monk who journeyed with him to the wilderness and brought him to the monastery of St. Macarius, the great, in Scete.
وكان يطلب من السيد المسيح أن يسهل خروجه من هذا العالم ليمضى إلى البرية. فإستجاب له السيد المسيح. وظهر له ملاك الرب فى زى راهب ورافقه إلى البرية حتى أوصله إلى دير الأنبا مكاريوس الكبير.

There he met with the saints Abba Abraham and Abba Gawargah (George), and became their disciple for three years. Then, they ordained him a monk. He led a life of great austerity in many fasts and prayers for seven years. He read constantly especially in the biography of St. Simon the Stylite, and he longed to imitate him. He left Scetis after taking the permission of the elders of the monastery.

There he met with the saints Abba Abraham and Abba Gawargah (George), and became their disciple for three years. Then, they ordained him a monk. He led a life of great austerity in many fasts and prayers for seven years. He read constantly especially in the biography of St. Simon the Stylite, and he longed to imitate him. He left Scetis after taking the permission of the elders of the monastery.

وهناك إلتقى مع القديسين أبرآم وجورجى وتتلمذ لهما مدة ثلاث سنوات فألبساه شكل الرهبنة. فصار يجاهد فى حياته النسكية بأصوام وصلوات مدة سبع سنوات وكان مداوماً على القراءة خاصة فى سيرة القديس سمعان العمودى. فإشتاق أن يتمثل به فترك برية شيهيت بعد إستئذان آباء الدير.
He went to nearby the city of Sakha, where he dwelt in a small church. The believers built a small dwelling for him on a something resembling a pillar and he went up to it.
He went to nearby the city of Sakha, where he dwelt in a small church. The believers built a small dwelling for him on a something resembling a pillar and he went up to it.
ومضى إلى نواحى سخا وأقام فى كنيسة صغيرة إلى أن بنى له المؤمنون مسكنا ًصغيرا ً على شبه عمود فصعد إليه ومكث به.
God performed many miracles through his hands and the Devils fought him but he overcame them with prayers and making the sign of the cross.
God performed many miracles through his hands and the Devils fought him but he overcame them with prayers and making the sign of the cross.
وقد صنع الله على يديه آيات ومعجزات كثيرة وكانت الشياطين تحاربه وكان ينتصر عليها بالصلاة ورشم علامة الصليب.
This Holy Father lived for 100 years, of which he spent 35 years in the world, five years a priest in Tinnis, and 10 years in the desert of Scetis and 50 years in solitude upon the pillar near Sakha.
This Holy Father lived for 100 years, of which he spent 35 years in the world, five years a priest in Tinnis, and 10 years in the desert of Scetis and 50 years in solitude upon the pillar near Sakha.
وعاش هذا الأب مائة سنة أقام منها 35 سنة فى العالم وخمس سنوات كاهناً بتانيس وعشر سنوات ببرية شيهيت ثم 50 سنة فوق العمود فى سخا.
When God wished to repose him from the labors of this world, he fell sick for a short while and then delivered up his soul into the hand of the Lord.
When God wished to repose him from the labors of this world, he fell sick for a short while and then delivered up his soul into the hand of the Lord.
ولما أراد الرب أن يريحه من أتعاب هذا العالم مرض قليلا ً وأسلم روحه الطاهرة بيد الرب.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا.أمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of Sts. Felix and Regula, his Sister, and St. Exuperantius
The Martyrdom of Sts. Felix and Regula, his Sister, and St. Exuperantius
استشهاد القديس فيلكس وريجولا أخته والقديس أكسيويرانتيوس

text.language: On this day also, Sts. Felix and Regula, his Sister, and St. Exuperantius were martyred.
On this day also, Sts. Felix and Regula, his Sister, and St. Exuperantius were martyred.
وأيضاً في مثل هذا اليوم كان إستشهاد القديس فيلكس وريجولا أخته والقديس أكسيويرانتيوس.
They were from the city of Thebes (Luxor) in Upper Egypt. Felix and Exuperantius joined the Theban Legion which was headed by St. Maurice. As of Regula, she accompanied her brother Felix.
They were from the city of Thebes (Luxor) in Upper Egypt. Felix and Exuperantius joined the Theban Legion which was headed by St. Maurice. As of Regula, she accompanied her brother Felix.
هؤلاء كانوا من مدينة طيبة بالصعيد. وأنضم فيلكس وأكسيوبرانتيوس إلى الفرقه الطيبية التى كان يرأسها القديس موريس. أما ريجولا فقد صاحبت شقيقها فيلكس.

When the member of Legion were steadfast in their faith in the Lord Christ, St. Maurice advised them to leave Agaunum. They went to Zurich where they spread out the Christian faith. Emperor Maximian had issued his orders to slay the entire Legion and also to pursue everyone related to it.

When the member of Legion were steadfast in their faith in the Lord Christ, St. Maurice advised them to leave Agaunum. They went to Zurich where they spread out the Christian faith. Emperor Maximian had issued his orders to slay the entire Legion and also to pursue everyone related to it.

ولما تمسكت الفرقة بإيمانها بالسيد المسيح نصحهم القديس موريس أن يرحلوا من أجاونوم فمضوا إلى زيورخ ونشروا فيها الإيمان المسيحى. إلا إن الإمبراطور مكسيميانوس كان قد أصدر أوامره بقتل الفرقة وأيضاً أخذ يتعقب كل من له علاقة بها.

The Governor seized these three Saints who confessed before him their faith in the Lord Christ and with their association with St. Maurice. He tortured them severely to deny the faith but they did not waver. Many miracles took place during torturing them as the healing of St. Regula after placing her in boiling wax and forcing her to drink melted Lead. Many believed and heard a voice from heaven saying to them; “Do not be afraid I am with you for your hour had come and the crowns are ready for you and you will have great honor among the heavenly hosts.”

The Governor seized these three Saints who confessed before him their faith in the Lord Christ and with their association with St. Maurice. He tortured them severely to deny the faith but they did not waver. Many miracles took place during torturing them as the healing of St. Regula after placing her in boiling wax and forcing her to drink melted Lead. Many believed and heard a voice from heaven saying to them; “Do not be afraid I am with you for your hour had come and the crowns are ready for you and you will have great honor among the heavenly hosts.”

فقبض الوالى على الثلاثه معاً. وإعترافوا أمامه بايمانهم المسيحى وبصلتهم بالقديس موريس. فعذبهم عذابا ً شديداً حتى ينكروا الإيمان فلم يتزعزعوا بل حدثت عجائب كثيرة أثناء العذاب منها شفاء القديسة ريجولا بعد وضعها فى شمع مغلى وإجبارها على شرب رصاص منصهر. فآمن كثيرون وكانوا يسمعون صوتاً من السماء يقول لهم: "لاتخافوا ها أنا معكم لأن ساعة دعوتكم قد أتت والأكاليل مُعدة لكم وسيكون لكم مجد عظيم وسط صفوف السمائيين".

Afterwards, the governor ordered them beheaded. Nevertheless, the three stood up and carried their heads on their hands and walked for about a distance of 28 yards (about 26 Meters) then kneeled down and fell once more. They shrouded, and buried them. They built a church for them on their name in Zurich which still exists till present time. Another church was built after their names in the place of their martyrdom in Zurich which is a canton of Switzerland. This canton chose these three saints as an emblem for them. Also the seal of the parliament of this canton is the image of these three saints carrying their heads on their hands. Moreover, a large convent was built that included a church consecrated after their names which has a part of their relics. The remainders of their relics were transferred in the year 1610 A.D. to the Church of Sts. Peter and Paul in the city of Andermatt in Switzerland, which still exist till now.

Afterwards, the governor ordered them beheaded. Nevertheless, the three stood up and carried their heads on their hands and walked for about a distance of 28 yards (about 26 Meters) then kneeled down and fell once more. They shrouded, and buried them. They built a church for them on their name in Zurich which still exists till present time. Another church was built after their names in the place of their martyrdom in Zurich which is a canton of Switzerland. This canton chose these three saints as an emblem for them. Also the seal of the parliament of this canton is the image of these three saints carrying their heads on their hands. Moreover, a large convent was built that included a church consecrated after their names which has a part of their relics. The remainders of their relics were transferred in the year 1610 A.D. to the Church of Sts. Peter and Paul in the city of Andermatt in Switzerland, which still exist till now.

بعد ذلك أمر الوالى بقطع رؤوسهم إلا إن الثلاثة قاموا وحملوا رؤوسهم فى أيديهم وساروا نحو مسافة ستة وعشرين مترا ً ثم ركعوا ورقدوا مرة أخرى. فكفنوهم ودفنوهم وبنوا كنيسة على إسمهم فى مدينة زيورخ لا تزال باقية حتى الأن. كما أقيمت على أسمهم كنيسة فى مكان الاستشهاد بزيورخ (هى مقاطعة بسويسرا إختارت هؤلاء القديسين شعاراً لها. كما إن ختم برلمان المقاطعة هو صورة للقديسين الثلاثة وكل منهم يحمل رأسه على يديه). وكذلك أقيم دير ضخم للراهبات به كنيسة مُكرسة بإسمهم وإليه نقل جزء من رفاتهم. أما بقية الرفات فنُقل فى سنة ( 161٠م) إلى كنيسة الرسولين بطرس وبولس فى مدينة أندرمات بسويسرا ولا زال باقياً حتى الآن.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
بركة صلواتهم فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Fifteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Fifteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الخامس عشر من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the fifteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the fifteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الخامس عشر من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إستقباله، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Translocation of the Body of St. Stephen the Archdeacon
The Translocation of the Body of St. Stephen the Archdeacon
نقل جسد القديس إسطفانوس رئيس الشمامسة إلى القسطنطينية

text.language: On this day, the church celebrates the translocation of the body of St. Stephen the Archdeacon and first Christian martyr. After his martyrdom in Jerusalem, some pious men took his pure body and buried him in a village called “Gamaliel," nearby Jerusalem. The where about of the body was unknown for around three hundred years.

On this day, the church celebrates the translocation of the body of St. Stephen the Archdeacon and first Christian martyr. After his martyrdom in Jerusalem, some pious men took his pure body and buried him in a village called “Gamaliel," nearby Jerusalem. The where about of the body was unknown for around three hundred years.

فى هذا اليوم تعيد الكنيسة بنقل جسد القديس إسطفانوس رئيس الشمامسة وأول الشهداء . وذلك بعد إستشهاده فى أورشليم حدث أن أخذ رجال أتقياء جسده الطاهر ودفنوه فى ضيعة يقال لها غمالائيل بالقرب من أورشليم. وظل جسده مجهولاً حوالى ثلاثمائة سنة.

Then St. Stephen, appeared to a priest called Lucianus. He told him his name and where his body was buried. The priest went to St. John, bishop of Jerusalem, and informed him of his vision. The bishop rose up, took with him two other bishops and the people of the church and went to the place where the body was. They dug in the specified place and a mighty earthquake took place, and a coffin appeared wherein the holy body. They carried it with great veneration until they came to Jerusalem.

Then St. Stephen, appeared to a priest called Lucianus. He told him his name and where his body was buried. The priest went to St. John, bishop of Jerusalem, and informed him of his vision. The bishop rose up, took with him two other bishops and the people of the church and went to the place where the body was. They dug in the specified place and a mighty earthquake took place, and a coffin appeared wherein the holy body. They carried it with great veneration until they came to Jerusalem.

ثم ظهر لكاهن يدعى لوكيانوس وعرفه بنفسِه ومكان جسده فمضى الكاهن إلى القديس يوحنا أسقف أورشليم وأخبره بما حدث ، فقام وبصحبته إثنان من الأساقفة وبعض الشعب وحفروا فى المكان المعين فحدث زلزال عظيم ثم ظهر تابوت فيه الأعضاء المقدسة فحملوه بإكرام عظيم حتى أدخلوه أورشليم.
Later on, a man whose name was Alexander a native of Constantinople built a great church for St. Stephen in Jerusalem and placed the holy body in it.
Later on, a man whose name was Alexander a native of Constantinople built a great church for St. Stephen in Jerusalem and placed the holy body in it.
ثم شيد له أحد أهالى القسطنطينية يدعى ألكسندروس كنيسة عظيمة بأورشليم ووضع الجسد فيها.

Five years later, Alexander departed, and his wife buried him by the side of the coffin of St. Stephen. Eight years later, Alexander's wife decided to go back to Constantinople and wished to take her husband's body with her. She came to the church, and she took the coffin wherein the body of St. Stephen thinking that it was the coffin of her husband. She embarked with it on a ship to Constantinople. In the middle of the voyage she heard voices of singing and praises coming from the coffin. She marveled, and examined the coffin. She realized that it was the coffin wherein was the body of St. Stephen, and this was the Will of God. She gave thanks to the Lord and went on her way until she arrived to Constantinople.

Five years later, Alexander departed, and his wife buried him by the side of the coffin of St. Stephen. Eight years later, Alexander's wife decided to go back to Constantinople and wished to take her husband's body with her. She came to the church, and she took the coffin wherein the body of St. Stephen thinking that it was the coffin of her husband. She embarked with it on a ship to Constantinople. In the middle of the voyage she heard voices of singing and praises coming from the coffin. She marveled, and examined the coffin. She realized that it was the coffin wherein was the body of St. Stephen, and this was the Will of God. She gave thanks to the Lord and went on her way until she arrived to Constantinople.

وبعد خمس سنوات تنيح ألكسندروس فدفنته زوجته بجانب تابوت القديس إسطفانوس. وبعد ثمانى سنوات أرادت هذه المرأة أن تذهب إلى القسطنطينية لتعيش هناك ، وأرادت أن تأخذ جسد زوجها معها. فأتت إلى الكنيسة وأخذت التابوت الذى به جسد القديس إسطفانوس ظنا ً منها أنه جسد زوجها. وكان ذلك بتدبير من الله. ولما ركبت المركب وسارت فى وسط البحر سمعت أصوات تسبيح وترتيل من داخل التابوت ، فتعجبت وتفرست فى التابوت فعرفت أنه التابوت الذى به جسد القديس إسطفانوس فشكرت الله على ذلك وواصلت المسير حتى وصلت إلى القسطنطينية.

There she went to Emperor Constantine the great and informed him about what had happened. The Emperor, the Patriarch, the bishops, the priests and the people of the city carried the coffin on their shoulders. On their way suddenly the procession stopped and heard a loud voice saying; “It is meet to place the body of the Saint here."

There she went to Emperor Constantine the great and informed him about what had happened. The Emperor, the Patriarch, the bishops, the priests and the people of the city carried the coffin on their shoulders. On their way suddenly the procession stopped and heard a loud voice saying; “It is meet to place the body of the Saint here."

وهناك أعلمت الملك قسطنطين الكبير بالخبر فخرج هو والآب البطريرك والأساقفة والكهنة وشعب المدينة وحملوا التابوت على أكتافهم وفى الطريق توقف الموكب فجأة بعد أن سمعوا صوتاً يدوى قائلاً: (هنا يجب أن يوضع جسد القديس).
The Emperor ordered that a church be built for the Saint in that place, where they laid the holy relics.
The Emperor ordered that a church be built for the Saint in that place, where they laid the holy relics.
فأمر الملك أن تبنى كنيسة فى ذلك المكان وأن توضع فيها الأعضاء المقدسة.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا.

Title.language: The Departure of Anba Athanasius El-Quosy
The Departure of Anba Athanasius El-Quosy
نياحة الأنبا أثناسيوس القوصي

text.language: On this day also, the bright star, Anba Athanasius El-Quosy departed. This bishop was the son of the eminent priest and skillful teacher Fr. Saleeb, a native of west Kamola.
On this day also, the bright star, Anba Athanasius El-Quosy departed. This bishop was the son of the eminent priest and skillful teacher Fr. Saleeb, a native of west Kamola.
وفيه أيضاً السراج المنير الأنبا أثناسيوس القوصي. كان هذا الآب الأسقف أبن القس الفاضل والمعلم الماهر صليب من أهالي غرب قمولا.

He became a monk in the monastery of the martyr Mar-Boctor known as the monastery of El-Kolah west of Kamola (monastery of Mar-Boctor in Naqada). He was consecrated a bishop for Quos by Pope Youannes X (John), the 85th patriarch, about the year 1365 A.D. He was assisted in the consecration by Anba Timotheos (Timothy) bishop of Ebreem and Abu-Khras (Nubba).

He became a monk in the monastery of the martyr Mar-Boctor known as the monastery of El-Kolah west of Kamola (monastery of Mar-Boctor in Naqada). He was consecrated a bishop for Quos by Pope Youannes X (John), the 85th patriarch, about the year 1365 A.D. He was assisted in the consecration by Anba Timotheos (Timothy) bishop of Ebreem and Abu-Khras (Nubba).

وترهب في دير الشهيد ماربقطر الصحراوي المعروف بدير الكولة بحاجر غرب قمولا (دير ماربقطر بنقادة) ورُسم أسقفاً على قوص بيد البابا يؤانس العاشر البطريرك ال ٨٥ حوالي سنة ١٣٦٥م. وقد شارك في تجليس الأنبا تيموثاؤس أسقف أبريم وأبو خراس (النوبة).

Anba Athanasius El-Quosy was interested in preserving the Coptic language so he published an introductory book in the Bohairic and Sahidic dialects called (Kiladet El-Tahreer Fi Elm El-Tafseer). He also published a book about personal and family law and another one about the consecration of El-Myron (Holy Oil).

Anba Athanasius El-Quosy was interested in preserving the Coptic language so he published an introductory book in the Bohairic and Sahidic dialects called (Kiladet El-Tahreer Fi Elm El-Tafseer). He also published a book about personal and family law and another one about the consecration of El-Myron (Holy Oil).
وأهتم بالحفاظ على اللغة القبطية فوضع مقدمة باللهجتين الصعيدية والبحيرية بعنوان "قلادة التحرير في علم التفسير" ووضع كتاباً عن الأحوال الشخصية ، وأخر عن تكريس الميرون.

He participated with Pope Gabriel IV, in the year 1374 A.D., in consecrating the Holy Myron in St. Macarius monastery. He also published El-Triadon, which is a book of rhymed poem in the Coptic Sahidic dialect in the year 1322 A.D. It is called the Triadica (tripartite); it consisted of 734 verses, the theme of which was religious instructions. They included personalities from the Holy Bible, some saints, and some of the ancient past glories of the church.

He participated with Pope Gabriel IV, in the year 1374 A.D., in consecrating the Holy Myron in St. Macarius monastery. He also published El-Triadon, which is a book of rhymed poem in the Coptic Sahidic dialect in the year 1322 A.D. It is called the Triadica (tripartite); it consisted of 734 verses, the theme of which was religious instructions. They included personalities from the Holy Bible, some saints, and some of the ancient past glories of the church.

وقد أشترك هذا الآب الأسقف أيضاً مع البابا غبريال الرابع سنة ١٣٧٤م في تكريس الميرون المقدس بدير القديس مكاريوس. وله أيضا كتاب في التريادون وهو شعرٌ باللغة القبطية الصعيدية مُقفى بأسم الثلاثية. ويحتوي على معلومات دينية تهذيبية تتضمن شخصيات من الكتاب المُقدس وطرفاً من أمجاد الماضي القديم.

He laid down many canons, to cover such topics as marriage, baptism, consecration of Myron, priesthood, in judging adultery, dealing with buying and selling, circumcision of boys and girls, and accepting the repentant.

He laid down many canons, to cover such topics as marriage, baptism, consecration of Myron, priesthood, in judging adultery, dealing with buying and selling, circumcision of boys and girls, and accepting the repentant.
وله أيضاً عدة قوانين في الزواج والمعمودية وتكريس الميرون ، وفي الكهنوت وفي أحكام الزنا وقوانين البيع والشراء ، وفي ختان الذكور والإناث وأيضاً قوانين في قبول التائب.
This honored father, the faithful steward, was the lighted lamp of his generation. After he completed his good endeavor departed in peace in the city of Quos.
This honored father, the faithful steward, was the lighted lamp of his generation. After he completed his good endeavor departed in peace in the city of Quos.
فكان هذا الآب الأسقف عاملاً رابحاً وسراج عصره المُنير. تنيح في قوص في الخامس عشر من توت.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Sixteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Sixteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم السادس عشر من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the sixteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the sixteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم السادس عشر من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Consecration of the church of Resurrection in Jerusalem
The Consecration of the church of Resurrection in Jerusalem
تكريس كنيسة القيامة بأورشليم

text.language: On this day of the year 51 of the martyrs (335 A.D.) was the consecration of the church of Resurrection in Jerusalem.
On this day of the year 51 of the martyrs (335 A.D.) was the consecration of the church of Resurrection in Jerusalem.
فى مثل هذا اليوم من سنة 51 للشهداء ( 335 م ) تم تكريس كنيسة القيامة بأورشليم.

After Queen Helena had discovered the Holy Cross, she ordered the construction of the church of Resurrection. When the splendid building was finished, Emperor Constantine asked Pope Athanasius, Patriarch of Alexandria, the Patriarch of Constantinople and the Patriarch of Antioch to go to Jerusalem with their bishops. They were received by St. Macarius, Bishop of Jerusalem.

After Queen Helena had discovered the Holy Cross, she ordered the construction of the church of Resurrection. When the splendid building was finished, Emperor Constantine asked Pope Athanasius, Patriarch of Alexandria, the Patriarch of Constantinople and the Patriarch of Antioch to go to Jerusalem with their bishops. They were received by St. Macarius, Bishop of Jerusalem.

وذلك أنه بعد أن أكتشفت الملكة هيلانة خشبة الصليب المقدس أمرت ببناء كنيسة القيامة فتم بناءها على أحسن طراز. ولما أكتمل البناء أرسل الإمبراطور قسطنطين الكبير إلى البابا أثناسيوس بطريرك الإسكندرية وإلى بطريرك القسطنطينية و بطريرك أنطاكية ليذهبوا إلى أورشليم ومعهم أساقفتهم .

They consecrated the church of the Resurrection and its altars. On the next day they walked around in a procession with the Holy Cross inside the church and around the rest of the holy places. Then they returned to their countries in peace.

They consecrated the church of the Resurrection and its altars. On the next day they walked around in a procession with the Holy Cross inside the church and around the rest of the holy places. Then they returned to their countries in peace.
وهناك أستقبلهم القديس مكاريوس أسقف أورشليم وكرسوا كنيسة القيامة ودشنوا المذابح فيها. وفى اليوم التالى طافوا بالصليب المقدس داخل الكنيسة وبقية المواضع المقدسة ثم عادوا إلى كراسيهم بسلام.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
بركة صلواتهم فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Seventeenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Seventeenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم السابع عشر من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the seventeenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the seventeenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم السابع عشر من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The commemoration of the Celebration of the Honorable Cross in the Church of Resurrection
The commemoration of the Celebration of the Honorable Cross in the Church of Resurrection
تذكار الإحتفال بالصليب المجيد في كنيسة القيامة

text.language: On this day of the year 51 of the martyrs (335 A.D.) the Patriarchs of the Christian churches celebrated the Honorable Cross. They were, the saintly Pope Athanasius the Apostolic, patriarch of Alexandria, Patriarch of Constantinople, Patriarch of Antioch, and St. Macarius, Patriarch of Jerusalem.

On this day of the year 51 of the martyrs (335 A.D.) the Patriarchs of the Christian churches celebrated the Honorable Cross. They were, the saintly Pope Athanasius the Apostolic, patriarch of Alexandria, Patriarch of Constantinople, Patriarch of Antioch, and St. Macarius, Patriarch of Jerusalem.

فى مثل هذا اليوم من سنة 51 للشهداء (335م) إحتفل بطاركة الكنائس المسيحية وهم البابا القديس أثناسيوس الرسولي بطريرك الإسكندرية وبطريرك القسطنطينية وبطريرك أنطاكية والقديس مكاريوس بطريرك أورشليم بالصليب المجيد فى كنيسة القيامة بإحتفال عظيم.

They carried the Honorable Cross in a procession inside the church of Resurrection in a splendid celebration worshipping the Lord. They offered prayers and celebrated the Divine Liturgies. They venerated the Cross and then placed it in a special place prepared for it in a vault made of silver.

They carried the Honorable Cross in a procession inside the church of Resurrection in a splendid celebration worshipping the Lord. They offered prayers and celebrated the Divine Liturgies. They venerated the Cross and then placed it in a special place prepared for it in a vault made of silver.
وطافوا به في أورشليم وسجدوا للرب أمام الصليب المجيد وأقاموا الصلوات والقداسات ثم وضعوا الصليب المقدس فى الموضع المخصص له داخل خزانة من الفضة.

This feast coincides also with the appearance of the sign of the Honorable Cross to the righteous Emperor Constantine the great. He was on his way to fight the tyrant Emperor Maxentius the son of Maximian in the year 312 A.D. He saw the sign of the Honorable Cross in the middle of the day in the sky along with his officers and soldiers, as a great light more brilliant than the light of the Sun. Under the Cross was written these words, “With this sign you shall conquer.” He was encouraged, strengthened and he put the image of the cross that he saw on all the banners and armors of his soldiers.

This feast coincides also with the appearance of the sign of the Honorable Cross to the righteous Emperor Constantine the great. He was on his way to fight the tyrant Emperor Maxentius the son of Maximian in the year 312 A.D. He saw the sign of the Honorable Cross in the middle of the day in the sky along with his officers and soldiers, as a great light more brilliant than the light of the Sun. Under the Cross was written these words, “With this sign you shall conquer.” He was encouraged, strengthened and he put the image of the cross that he saw on all the banners and armors of his soldiers.

ويوافق هذا العيد أيضاً ظهور علامة الصليب المجيد للإمبراطور قسطنطين الكبير وهو ذاهب لمحاربة الطاغية مكنتيوس بن مكسيميانوس سنة (31٢م) وذلك أنه رأى أثناء الظهيرة فى السماء ومعه الضباط والجنود علامة الصليب المجيد من نور عظيم أبهى من نور الشمس وتحت الصليب كلمات (بهذا تغلب) فوضع رسم الصليب هذا على رايات جنوده جميعاً.
He was victorious in the war with the power of the Honorable Cross. That had a profound effect for him accepting the faith.
He was victorious in the war with the power of the Honorable Cross. That had a profound effect for him accepting the faith.
فتشجع وتشدد وإنتصر فى الحرب بقوة الصليب المجيد. مما كان له أبلغ الآثر فى قبوله الإيمان المسيحى بعد ذلك.
The Blessing of the Honorable Cross be with us all. . Amen.
The Blessing of the Honorable Cross be with us all. . Amen.
بركة الصليب المجيد فلتكن معنا. آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Castor, the Presbyter
The Martyrdom of St. Castor, the Presbyter
إستشهاد القديس قسطور القس

text.language: On this day also, the saint Abba Castor, the Presbyter, was martyred during the reign of Emperor Diocletian, in the fourth century.
On this day also, the saint Abba Castor, the Presbyter, was martyred during the reign of Emperor Diocletian, in the fourth century.
وفيه أيضاً إستشهد القديس أبا قسطور القس فى أيام الإمبراطور دقلديانوس فى القرن الرابع الميلادى.

This saint was born in the village of Bardanouha , in Upper Egypt to Christian parents. They raised him in piety and in virtues and he was ordained a reader. He stayed close to the church. Then he was married and ordained a presbyter for the church of his village. He shepherd the people with the best of care. He had a son called Afraham after his father’s name and a daughter called Dermoudah.

This saint was born in the village of Bardanouha , in Upper Egypt to Christian parents. They raised him in piety and in virtues and he was ordained a reader. He stayed close to the church. Then he was married and ordained a presbyter for the church of his village. He shepherd the people with the best of care. He had a son called Afraham after his father’s name and a daughter called Dermoudah.
ولد هذا القديس فى قرية بردنوها بصعيد مصر من أبوين مسيحيين وقد ربياه على الفضيلة والتقوى. وقد رُسم شماساً فلازم الكنيسة وقد أنجب إبناً أسماه أفراهام على أسم والده ، وأبنة أسماها درمودة.

Fr. Castor (Kastor) grew to be a venerable priest in a good old age and his people loved him. When Diocletian incited persecution against the Christians, he went around confirming his people in the Orthodox faith. He went to the city of el-kais , the capital of the area, and which was close to his village, to visit the imprisoned Christians because of their faith in Christ. He strengthened and encouraged them. When the Governor was informed that Fr. Castor encouraged the Christians to be steadfast in the faith and not to worship the idols, he seized him. They tortured him with every kind of torture but the Lord comforted, strengthened, and healed him.

Fr. Castor (Kastor) grew to be a venerable priest in a good old age and his people loved him. When Diocletian incited persecution against the Christians, he went around confirming his people in the Orthodox faith. He went to the city of el-kais , the capital of the area, and which was close to his village, to visit the imprisoned Christians because of their faith in Christ. He strengthened and encouraged them. When the Governor was informed that Fr. Castor encouraged the Christians to be steadfast in the faith and not to worship the idols, he seized him. They tortured him with every kind of torture but the Lord comforted, strengthened, and healed him.

وكبر القس قسطور فى العمر وأصبح كاهناً وقوراً وذا شيبة صالحة وكان محبوباً من شعبه وكان يثبتهم على الإ يمان الأرثوذكسي المستقيم. وذهب إلى بلدة القيس (وهي قرية تابعة لمركز بنى مزار - محافظة المنيا) عاصمة المنطقة والقريبة من بلدته ليفتقد المسيحيين المسجونين فيها بسبب إيمانهم بالمسيح. وكان يثبتهم ويشجعهم ولما بلغ الوالى أن القس قسطور يشجع المسيحيين على الثبات فى الإيمان وعدم السجود للأوثان ، أمر بالقبض عليه وإحضاره مع المسجونين للتعذيب الشديد. فعذبوه بكل أنواع العذاب وكان الرب يعزيه ويقويه ويشفيه.

Afterwards, the Governor sent him to the governor of Old Cairo whose name was Kelkianus to torture him again. Many miracles and wonders had been manifested during his torture and imprisonment. Then, he sent him to the Governor of Alexandria. The Governor of Alexandria also tortured him, in spite of his old age, severely, then he gave him a deadly poison to drink, however, it did not harm him because the saint made the sign of the Cross over the chalice before he drank it. When he became weary of torturing him, he ordered to behead him. He was about one hundred and ten years old.

Afterwards, the Governor sent him to the governor of Old Cairo whose name was Kelkianus to torture him again. Many miracles and wonders had been manifested during his torture and imprisonment. Then, he sent him to the Governor of Alexandria. The Governor of Alexandria also tortured him, in spite of his old age, severely, then he gave him a deadly poison to drink, however, it did not harm him because the saint made the sign of the Cross over the chalice before he drank it. When he became weary of torturing him, he ordered to behead him. He was about one hundred and ten years old.

وبعد ذلك أرسله الوالى إلى والى مصر القديمة وكان إسمه كلكيانوس ليعذبه. وبعد أن عذبه كثيراً ظهرت منه معجزات وعجائب كثيرة أثناء سجنه وتعذيبه أرسله إلى والى الإسكندرية. وعلى الرغم من كِبر سنه عذبه هو أيضاً بشدة وقسوة ثم سقاه سُماً ممُيتاً فلم يضره لأنه رشم الكأس بعلامة الصليب الكريم قبل أن يشربه. ولما تعب الوالي من تعذيبه أمر بقطع رأسه وكان عمره فى ذلك الوقت يقرب من مائة وعشر سنين.

While he was praying before his execution, a voice from heaven called upon him saying; “O my beloved Castor come to the place of rest.” Then they cut off his head, and thus he received the crown of martyrdom.

While he was praying before his execution, a voice from heaven called upon him saying; “O my beloved Castor come to the place of rest.” Then they cut off his head, and thus he received the crown of martyrdom.
وبينما هو يصلى قبل تنفيذ الحكم ناداه صوت من السماء قائلاً : ياحبيبى قسطور تعالى إلى موضع الراحة ثم قطعوا رأسه فنال إكليل الشهادة.

St. Julius El-Akfehasy (of Aqfahs) wrote his biography, shrouded his body, and sent him to his hometown Bardanouha. The people of his village received him with praises and hymns. They carried his body and hid it in his house until the end of persecution. Then they built a church on his name which was consecrated on the seventeenth day of the month of Amshir.

St. Julius El-Akfehasy (of Aqfahs) wrote his biography, shrouded his body, and sent him to his hometown Bardanouha. The people of his village received him with praises and hymns. They carried his body and hid it in his house until the end of persecution. Then they built a church on his name which was consecrated on the seventeenth day of the month of Amshir.

وقام القديس يوليوس الأقفهصى بكتابة سيرته وتكفين جسده وأرسله إلى بلده بردنوها . وهناك أستقبله أهلها بالتسابيح والألحان. وحملوه إلى بيته حتى إنقضى زمن الاضطهاد ، فبنوا كنيسة على إسمه كُرست فى اليوم السابع عشر من شهر أمشير.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا. آمين .

Title.language: The Departure of St. Theognosta
The Departure of St. Theognosta
نياحة القديسة ثاؤغنسطا

text.language: On this day also, the blessed Theognosta, departed. That was during the reign of the righteous Emperors Honorius and Arcadius. She lived in a convent nearby Rome, and she was taken captive by the men of the ruler of El-Raha . They presented him with her. The wife of the ruler took her as a maidservant for herself.

On this day also, the blessed Theognosta, departed. That was during the reign of the righteous Emperors Honorius and Arcadius. She lived in a convent nearby Rome, and she was taken captive by the men of the ruler of El-Raha . They presented him with her. The wife of the ruler took her as a maidservant for herself.
وفيه أيضاً تنيحت القديسة ثاؤغنسطا ، وذلك فى أيام الملكين أركاديوس وأنوريوس وكانت تقيم بدير بالقرب من مدينة روما فوقعت أسيرة فى أيدي رجال حاكم الرها حيث قدموها له. فإتخذتها زوجة الحاكم جارية لها.

The captured nun Theognosta performed her duties with joy and satisfaction and the Lord prospered her ways. The Lord gave her grace in the sight of her mistress, so she appointed her head for all maidservants working in the palace. As of St. Theognosta, her heart was devoted to the heavenly life pursuing her prayers and asceticism with great diligence.

The captured nun Theognosta performed her duties with joy and satisfaction and the Lord prospered her ways. The Lord gave her grace in the sight of her mistress, so she appointed her head for all maidservants working in the palace. As of St. Theognosta, her heart was devoted to the heavenly life pursuing her prayers and asceticism with great diligence.

فمارست الراهبة ثاؤغنسطا عملها في السبي ببهجة ورضا فأنجح الرب طريقها وأعطاها نعمة فى عين سيدتها. فأقامتها رئيسة على كل العاملات بالقصر أما هى فكان قلبها متعلقاً بالحياة السماوية وتمارس نسكها وصلواتها بجهاد عظيم.

Afterwards, the son of the ruler faced a serious illness and all the capabilities of the physicians failed to cure him. His mother, asked Theognosta to pray for him. She stretched her hands and prayed to God to be glorified in this only son for the salvation of many. When she finished from her prayer, the child was immediately cured. The ruler freed her from captivity and gave her an isolated place as she requested. She dwelt in that place worshipping God unceasingly.

Afterwards, the son of the ruler faced a serious illness and all the capabilities of the physicians failed to cure him. His mother, asked Theognosta to pray for him. She stretched her hands and prayed to God to be glorified in this only son for the salvation of many. When she finished from her prayer, the child was immediately cured. The ruler freed her from captivity and gave her an isolated place as she requested. She dwelt in that place worshipping God unceasingly.

وحدث أن تعرض إبن الحاكم لمرض شديد فشلت كل إمكانات الأطباء فى شفائه. فطلبت أمه من ثاؤغنسطا أن تصلى لأجله، فبسطت يديها وصلت إلى الله أن يتمجد فى هذا الإبن الوحيد لأجل خلاص الكثيرين. ولما إنتهت من صلاتها شفى الطفل فى الحال. فحررها الحاكم من العبودية وأعطى لها مكاناً منفرداً كطلبها فأقامت متعبدة فيه لله بلا إنقطاع.
Not long after, the wife of the ruler became ill, so she asked Theognosta to pray for her, and God granted her healing with the prayers of the saint.
Not long after, the wife of the ruler became ill, so she asked Theognosta to pray for her, and God granted her healing with the prayers of the saint.
وبعد أيام قليلة مرضت زوجة الحاكم ، فطلبت ثاؤغنسطا لتصلى لأجلها فوهبها الله نعمة الشفاء بصلاتها.

One day that ruler went out to the wilderness to hunt and he was lost. Hence, he remembered St. Theognosta and how she calls upon the Lord Christ in her hardships, and how she signs herself with the sign of the cross and she receives divine power. The ruler cried out asking the Lord Christ, the God of Theognosta to save him. Immediately, he saw light in the shape of the sign of the cross leading him until he entered the city.

One day that ruler went out to the wilderness to hunt and he was lost. Hence, he remembered St. Theognosta and how she calls upon the Lord Christ in her hardships, and how she signs herself with the sign of the cross and she receives divine power. The ruler cried out asking the Lord Christ, the God of Theognosta to save him. Immediately, he saw light in the shape of the sign of the cross leading him until he entered the city.

ثم خرج الحاكم إلى البرية ذات يوم ليصطاد فضل الطريق في العودة. حينئذ تذكر القديسة ثاؤغنسطا وكيف تلتجئ إلى السيد المسيح فى الضيقات وترشم ذاتها بعلامة الصليب فتنال قوة إلهية. فصرخ الحاكم وطلب من السيد المسيح إله ثاؤغنسطا أن ينقذه. وإذ به يرى علامة صليب من نور تتقدمه حتى دخل المدينة.

His people rejoiced, and called St. Theognosta to preach to them the faith of the Lord Christ. She was delighted and preached them the faith. She asked the ruler to send to Emperor Honorius to delegate for them a righteous priest. He sent to them a priest called Theophanius who preached them the faith of the Lord Christ until all believed.
