Theophanius was ordained a bishop for El-Raha as the ruler and the people requested.

His people rejoiced, and called St. Theognosta to preach to them the faith of the Lord Christ. She was delighted and preached them the faith. She asked the ruler to send to Emperor Honorius to delegate for them a righteous priest. He sent to them a priest called Theophanius who preached them the faith of the Lord Christ until all believed. Theophanius was ordained a bishop for El-Raha as the ruler and the people requested.

ففرح به شعبه وإستدعوا القديسة ثاؤغنسطا لكى تبشرهم بالإيمان بالسيد المسيح. فتهللت جداً وبشرتهم بالإيمان وطلبت من الحاكم أن يرسل إلى الإمبراطور أنوريوس لكى يرسل لهم كاهناً تقياً فأرسل لهم قس يدعى ثاؤفانيوس الذى صار يكرز مجاهداً بالإيمان حتى آمن الجميع. وسيم ثاؤفانيوس أسقف على الرها كطلب الحاكم والشعب.
St. Theognosta served the women and taught them the faith. God allowed for her a short illness then departed in peace.
St. Theognosta served the women and taught them the faith. God allowed for her a short illness then departed in peace.
وكانت القديسة ثاؤغنسطا تقوم بخدمة النساء. وسمح الله لها بمرض قصير وتنيحت بسلام.
The blessing of her prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of her prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلواتها فلتكن معنا. آمين .

Title.language: The Departure of the Saint el-Moallem (Master) Girgis el-Gohari
The Departure of the Saint el-Moallem (Master) Girgis el-Gohari
نياحة القديس المعلم جرجس الجوهرى

text.language: On this day also, of the year 1557 of the martyrs (1810 A.D.) the saint el-Moallem Girgis El-Gohari, departed. El-Moallem (Master) Girgis El-Gohari was one of the famous Copts in the late 18th century and early 19the century. He was the brother of El-Moallem Ibrahim El-Gohari .

On this day also, of the year 1557 of the martyrs (1810 A.D.) the saint el-Moallem Girgis El-Gohari, departed. El-Moallem (Master) Girgis El-Gohari was one of the famous Copts in the late 18th century and early 19the century. He was the brother of El-Moallem Ibrahim El-Gohari .
وفي هذا اليوم أيضاً نياحة القديس المعلم جرجس الجوهرى. كان المعلم جرجس الجوهرى من مشاهير الأقباط فى أواخر القرن الثامن عشر وأوائل القرن التاسع عشر . وهو شقيق المعلم إبراهيم الجوهرى.

He was reared and educated as was his brother in el-Kuttab of the city of Qualiob as was the system of that time. He learned reading, writing, and arithmetic along with religious studies and Coptic language. When he grew up he joined his brother, who held the position of head scribes of Egypt , in his daily duties and in office works. His brother was the best teacher and an excellent mentor for him, and being close to his brother had a great influence on his future life and a motive for his success.

He was reared and educated as was his brother in el-Kuttab of the city of Qualiob as was the system of that time. He learned reading, writing, and arithmetic along with religious studies and Coptic language. When he grew up he joined his brother, who held the position of head scribes of Egypt , in his daily duties and in office works. His brother was the best teacher and an excellent mentor for him, and being close to his brother had a great influence on his future life and a motive for his success.

وقد تربى مثل أخيه فى كتاب مدينة قليوب كنظام ذلك العصر. فتعلم القراءة والكتابة والحساب علاوة على العلوم الدينية واللغة القبطية. ولما كبر أشركه شقيقه المعلم إبراهيم الذى كان يشغل منصب رئيس كتاب مصر فى الأعمال والأمور الكتابية فكان له خير مُعلم وأفضل مرشد. وكانت ملازمته لأخيه ذات أثر فعال فى مستقبل حياته وسبباً فى نجاحه.

He held the position of head of El-Mobashereen after the departure of his brother El-Moallem Ibrahim El-Gohari. El-Moallem Girgis conducted the affairs of his position under four different periods: During the reign of el-Mamalik, the rule of the French expedition, the reign of the Turks, and the beginning of the reign of Muhammad Ali Pasha.

He held the position of head of El-Mobashereen after the departure of his brother El-Moallem Ibrahim El-Gohari. El-Moallem Girgis conducted the affairs of his position under four different periods: During the reign of el-Mamalik, the rule of the French expedition, the reign of the Turks, and the beginning of the reign of Muhammad Ali Pasha.

عندما تقلد منصب رياسة المباشرين وهي وظيفة تشبه وظيفه رئيس الوزراء اليوم بعد نياحة أخيه المعلم إبراهيم الجوهرى. وقد باشر المعلم جرجس شئون وظيفته فى أربعة عهود مختلفة فى حكم المماليك ومدة حكم الحملة الفرنسية ومدة حكم الأتراك ثم أول حكم محمد على باشا.

He faced many difficulties during his public life. He was an outstanding man, and generous in giving. He donated much money to the poor, the needy, churches, and the monasteries, especially on feast days. He supported Pope Marcus the 8th (Mark VIII) in building the great St. Mark church in el-Azbakiya and the Patriarchal residence adjacent to it, from their own possessions. His brother Ibrahim had obtained before his departure the decree from the Sultan to build the church. Pope Mark VIII appointed him administrator for many of the churches in Cairo, and Old Cairo for his love for the churches and its renovation and maintenance.

He faced many difficulties during his public life. He was an outstanding man, and generous in giving. He donated much money to the poor, the needy, churches, and the monasteries, especially on feast days. He supported Pope Marcus the 8th (Mark VIII) in building the great St. Mark church in el-Azbakiya and the Patriarchal residence adjacent to it, from their own possessions. His brother Ibrahim had obtained before his departure the decree from the Sultan to build the church. Pope Mark VIII appointed him administrator for many of the churches in Cairo, and Old Cairo for his love for the churches and its renovation and maintenance.

وقد لاقى شدائد كثيرة وكان عظيم النفس كريم فى العطاء يوزع على الفقراء والمساكين والكنائس والأديرة الأموال الكثيرة خصوصاً فى المناسبات. كما أنه ساعد البابا مرقس الثامن فى بناء الكنيسة المرقسية الكبرى بالأزبكية ومقر البطريركية المجاور لها من أملاكه وأملاك أخيه الذى كان قد حصل قبل نياحته على فرمان من الباب العالى ببنائها. هذا وقد عينه البابا مرقس الثامن ناظراً على كثير من كنائس القاهرة ومصر القديمة وذلك لمحبته الكبيرة للكنائس وأهتمامه بتعميرها والعناية بها.

El-Moallem Girgis, Later in his life, fell ill and departed in peace. He was buried beside his brother in their private tomb beside the church of St. George in Darb-El-Taqa, in Old Cairo. Their tomb still exists till now under a small church where prayers are offered on their days of commemoration.

El-Moallem Girgis, Later in his life, fell ill and departed in peace. He was buried beside his brother in their private tomb beside the church of St. George in Darb-El-Taqa, in Old Cairo. Their tomb still exists till now under a small church where prayers are offered on their days of commemoration.

مرَض المعلم جرجس فى أواخر حياته ثم تنيح بسلام ودفُن بجوار شقيقه المعلم إبراهيم الجوهري فى المدفن الخاص بهما بجوار كنيسة مار جرجس بدرب التقا بمصر القديمة. ولا يزال قبرهما موجودا حتى الآن وفوقه كنيسة صغيرة يصُلى فيها فى تذكاراتهما.
The blessing of the prayers of this saintly Archon (lay-leader) be with us all, and Glory be to Our God forever. Amen
The blessing of the prayers of this saintly Archon (lay-leader) be with us all, and Glory be to Our God forever. Amen
بركة صلوات هذا الأرخن القديس فلتكن معنا ولربنا المجد دائما أبدياً. آمين.

Title.language: The Eighteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Eighteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الثامن عشر من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the eighteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the eighteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الثامن عشر من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Second day of the Feast of the Cross
The Second day of the Feast of the Cross
ثانى يوم عيد الصليب المجيد

text.language: On this day, the church celebrates the second day of the feast of the Honorable Cross. The rites of prayers are in the Hossana and joyful tunes.
On this day, the church celebrates the second day of the feast of the Honorable Cross. The rites of prayers are in the Hossana and joyful tunes.
فى هذا اليوم تعُيد الكنيسة بتذكار اليوم الثانى لعيد الصليب المجيد. ويُصلى بالطقس الشعانينى والفرايحى.
The blessing of the Honorable Cross be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of the Honorable Cross be with us all. Amen.
بركة الصليب المجيد فلتكن معنا. آمين .

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Prophorius (Porphyrius)
The Martyrdom of St. Prophorius (Porphyrius)
إستشهاد القديس بروفوريوس

text.language: On this day also, St. Prophorius, was martyred. Early in his life he was pagan and worked as a comedian and jester. That was during the reign of the infidel Emperor Julian.
On this day also, St. Prophorius, was martyred. Early in his life he was pagan and worked as a comedian and jester. That was during the reign of the infidel Emperor Julian.
وفى مثل هذا اليوم أيضاً أستشهد القديس بروفوريوس. وكان فى أول حياته وثنياً وكان يعمل ممثلاً هزلياً فى عهد الإمبراطور يوليانوس الجاحد.

The Emperor on his birth day, had a great celebration to which he invited the nobles of his kingdom. He brought jesters, comedians, and people of the circus; to entertain the gathering, Prophorius was one of them.

The Emperor on his birth day, had a great celebration to which he invited the nobles of his kingdom. He brought jesters, comedians, and people of the circus; to entertain the gathering, Prophorius was one of them.
الذى فى يوم مولده أقام حفلاً كبيراً لعظماء مملكته وأحضر رجال الملاهى لإحياء هذا الحفل وكان بينهم بروفوريوس.

The emperor ordered him to mock the Christian rituals. He started acting some of the rituals and when he came to the ritual of the holy baptism, he made the sign of the Cross over the water in the Name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. The Lord enlightened his mind and he perceived a divine grace coming down on the water and was covered with great light. He immersed himself into the water three times, then went up and put on his clothes. He confessed that he became Christian. The people present thought that this was a part of the act, but Prophorius continued to shout I am Christian. The Emperor and all who were present were baffled when they saw him insisting on his confession.

The emperor ordered him to mock the Christian rituals. He started acting some of the rituals and when he came to the ritual of the holy baptism, he made the sign of the Cross over the water in the Name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. The Lord enlightened his mind and he perceived a divine grace coming down on the water and was covered with great light. He immersed himself into the water three times, then went up and put on his clothes. He confessed that he became Christian. The people present thought that this was a part of the act, but Prophorius continued to shout I am Christian. The Emperor and all who were present were baffled when they saw him insisting on his confession.

وحدث أن أمره الملك أن يستهزئ بطقوس المسيحيين. فقام بتمثيل بعض الطقوس وعندما وصل الى طقس المعمودية المُقدسة رشم علامة الصليب على الماء فأضاء الرب بصيرته فرأى نعمة إلهية قد حلت على الماء ونوراً عظيماً قد غشاه. فقام وغطس فى الماء ثلاث مرات ثم صعد منه ولبس ثيابه وأقر أنه مسيحى. فحسب الحاضرون ذلك أنه أحد أدوار التمثيلية لكن بروفوريوس صار يصيح بشدة أيضاً : أنا مسيحى أنا مسيحى. فاندهش الملك وكل الحاضرين حينما رأوه جاداً فى حديثه.

The emperor started to befriend him promising him with many gifts. When he failed to turn him away of his faith in the Lord Christ he rebuked and threatened him. Finally, the emperor ordered his neck cut off, so he received the crown of martyrdom.

The emperor started to befriend him promising him with many gifts. When he failed to turn him away of his faith in the Lord Christ he rebuked and threatened him. Finally, the emperor ordered his neck cut off, so he received the crown of martyrdom.
فبدأ الملك يلاطفه واعداً إياه بعطايا جزيلة. ولما لم يفلح فى إرجاعه عن الإيمان بالسيد المسيح أمر بقطع رأسه فنال إكليل الشهادة.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا أمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Stephen the Presbyter, and St. Niceta (Niketa)
The Martyrdom of St. Stephen the Presbyter, and St. Niceta (Niketa)
إستشهاد القديس إسطفانوس القس والقديسة نيكيتى

text.language: On this day also, the church celebrates the commemoration of the martyrdom of St. Stephen the Presbyter, and St. Niceta (Niketa).
On this day also, the church celebrates the commemoration of the martyrdom of St. Stephen the Presbyter, and St. Niceta (Niketa).
وفى مثل هذا اليوم تعيد الكنيسة بتذكار إستشهاد القديس إسطفانوس القس والقديسة نيكيتى.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
بركة صلواتهما فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. أمين.

Title.language: The Nineteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Nineteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم التاسع عشر من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the nineteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the nineteenth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم التاسع عشر من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Third day of the Feast of the Cross
The Third day of the Feast of the Cross
ثالث يوم عيد الصليب المجيد

text.language: Today the church celebrates the third day and the last of the feast of the Cross. The rites of prayers are in the Hossana and joyful tunes.
Today the church celebrates the third day and the last of the feast of the Cross. The rites of prayers are in the Hossana and joyful tunes.
تحتفل الكنيسة اليوم باليوم الثالث والأخير من أيام عيد الصليب المجيد ، ويصلى بالطقس الشعانينى والفرايحى .
The blessing of the Honorable Cross be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of the Honorable Cross be with us all. Amen.
بركة الصليب المجيد فلتكن معنا. آمين.

Title.language: The Commemoration of the lifting up of St. Gregory, from the Pit
The Commemoration of the lifting up of St. Gregory, from the Pit
تذكار إصعاد القديس غريغوريوس من الجب

text.language: On this day also we commemorate the lifting up of St. Gregory, the Armenians, from the pit. This saint was born to royal descendant in Armenia and his father was put to death, but Gregory and his brother survived. Their caregiver fled away with them to Caesarea, in Cappadocia, where she raised them in a life of piety and holiness. Gregory was adorned with many Christian virtues and he excelled in Philosophy and various subjects. He worked in the royal court of king Tiridates.

On this day also we commemorate the lifting up of St. Gregory, the Armenians, from the pit. This saint was born to royal descendant in Armenia and his father was put to death, but Gregory and his brother survived. Their caregiver fled away with them to Caesarea, in Cappadocia, where she raised them in a life of piety and holiness. Gregory was adorned with many Christian virtues and he excelled in Philosophy and various subjects. He worked in the royal court of king Tiridates.

فى هذا اليوم تعيد الكنيسة بتذكار إصعاد القديس غريغوريوس الأرمنى من الجب. وقد ولد هذا القديس من سلالة ملكية فى أرمينيا ومات والده مقتولاً فبقى غريغوريوس مع أخيه وهربت بهما مربيتهما إلى قيصرية الكبادوك حيث قامت بتربيتهما فى حياة التقوى والقداسة. وكان غريغوريوس يتحلى بالفضائل المسيحية مع نبوغه فى العلم والفلسفة ثم خدم فى بلاط إبن الملك تريداته.

One day, the King ordered him to offer a sacrifice to the Idols, so Gregory informed him that he was Christian. The King was raged and ordered to torture the Saint, but the Lord saved and healed him. Finally the King ordered to threw him in a deep pit to die there from thirst and hunger.

One day, the King ordered him to offer a sacrifice to the Idols, so Gregory informed him that he was Christian. The King was raged and ordered to torture the Saint, but the Lord saved and healed him. Finally the King ordered to threw him in a deep pit to die there from thirst and hunger.
وفى أحد الأيام أمره الملك أن يقدم ذبيحة للأوثان فأخبره الشاب غريغوريوس بأنه مسيحى. فغصب الملك وأمر بتعذيبه وكان الرب يخلص ويشفيه. أخيراً أمر الملك بالقائه فى جب عميق ليموت فيه جوعاً وعطشاً.

The Lord preserved his life in the pit. Near the pit lived an old widow, and she saw in a vision someone telling her, "Make bread and cast it into this pit," and she continued to do this daily for 15 years.

The Lord preserved his life in the pit. Near the pit lived an old widow, and she saw in a vision someone telling her, "Make bread and cast it into this pit," and she continued to do this daily for 15 years.
فحفظه الله فى الجب وأعد الله له سيدة عجوز أبصرت فى رؤيا من يقول لها: إصنعى خبزاً وألقيه فى هذا الجب كل يوم فكانت تفعل ذلك لمدة خمسة عشر عاما ً.

The King happened to suffer from a serious illness from which he did not recover. The angel of the Lord appeared to his sister ant told her, "Unless you bring up Gregory out of the pit, your brother will not be cured." The next morning, she told the men of the royal court what she saw. They threw a rope into the pit to lift up the new Daniel from the pit alive. The people of the city received him with great veneration. The King’s sister asked him to forgive her brother and to pray for his healing. The Lord answered his prayers and the King was healed. Nevertheless, a mark was left in his body to remind him of his evil past.

The King happened to suffer from a serious illness from which he did not recover. The angel of the Lord appeared to his sister ant told her, "Unless you bring up Gregory out of the pit, your brother will not be cured." The next morning, she told the men of the royal court what she saw. They threw a rope into the pit to lift up the new Daniel from the pit alive. The people of the city received him with great veneration. The King’s sister asked him to forgive her brother and to pray for his healing. The Lord answered his prayers and the King was healed. Nevertheless, a mark was left in his body to remind him of his evil past.

وحدث أن مرض الملك مرضاً شديداً فظهر ملاك الرب لأخته وأعلمها أن أخاها لن يبرأ ما لم يصعد غريغوريوس من الجب. وفى الصباح أخبرت رجال الدولة بما رأت ، فالقوا حبلاً ليرفعوا دانيال الجديد من الجب حياً. فأستقبلته الجماهير بإحتفال عظيم وطلبت منه أخت الملك أن يصفح عن أخيها ويصلى من أجل شفائه. فإستجاب له الرب وشفى الملك مع ترك علامة بجسده لتذكره بماضيه الأثيم.
His complete biography and his departure are mentioned under the 15th day of the month of Kiahk.
His complete biography and his departure are mentioned under the 15th day of the month of Kiahk.
أما بقية جهاده ونياحته مذكورة تحت اليوم الخامس عشر من شهر كيهك.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. أمين.

Title.language: The Twentieth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Twentieth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم العشرون من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the twentieth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the twentieth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم العشرون من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Theopista
The Departure of St. Theopista
نياحة القديسة تاؤبستى

text.language: On this day the church commemorates the departure of St. Theopista. She was married and had a son. Her husband died while she was still young. She vowed to spend the rest of her life in worship, asceticism, and raising her son in the fear of God. She started to practice the spiritual life. She persevered in fasting, prayers and kneeling.

On this day the church commemorates the departure of St. Theopista. She was married and had a son. Her husband died while she was still young. She vowed to spend the rest of her life in worship, asceticism, and raising her son in the fear of God. She started to practice the spiritual life. She persevered in fasting, prayers and kneeling.

فى هذا اليوم تعيد الكنيسة بتذكار نياحة القديسة ثاؤبستى. وكانت قد تزوجت ورزقت بولدٍ ثم مات زوجها وهى ماتزال شابة فنذرت أن تقضى بقية حياتها فى العبادة والنسك وتربية إبنها فى مخافة الله. فسلكت السيرة الروحانية مواظبة على الصوم والصلاة والميطانيات.
She went to Abba Macarius, bishop of Nekios, and asked him to pray on her and put on her the monastic garb. The bishop promised to fulfill her wish after she had tried herself for one year.
She went to Abba Macarius, bishop of Nekios, and asked him to pray on her and put on her the monastic garb. The bishop promised to fulfill her wish after she had tried herself for one year.
ثم مضت إلى الأنبا مكاريوس أسقف نيقيوس(حالياً زاوية رزين بمحافظة المنوفية) وسألته أن يلبسها إسكيم الرهبنة. فوعدها بهذا بعد أن تُجرب نفسها لمدة سنة.

She went to her house and shut herself in a small room. Her son, who was then 12 years old, was taking care of her needs. She embarked in strenuous worships with asceticism and great devotion. The year elapsed, and the bishop had forgotten that he had promised this saint that he would put on her the garb of monasticism.

She went to her house and shut herself in a small room. Her son, who was then 12 years old, was taking care of her needs. She embarked in strenuous worships with asceticism and great devotion. The year elapsed, and the bishop had forgotten that he had promised this saint that he would put on her the garb of monasticism.
فمضت إلي بيتها وحبست نفسها فى حجرة وأخذت تمارس الحياة النسكية بإجتهاد عظيم. ولما إنقضت السنة ونسى الأب الأسقف طلبها.

One night, He saw her in his sleep in a shining figure, telling him, "My father, why did you forget me till now? And I am passing away tonight?" The bishop saw that as if he was awake, he prayed on her the prayer for ordaining monks, and put on her the garb of monasticism. When he did not find a Kalansowa (cover for the head), he took off his own and put it on her head. Then he put on her the holy Eskeem. She had a silver cross in her hand which she gave to him saying, "Accept this cross from your disciple."

One night, He saw her in his sleep in a shining figure, telling him, "My father, why did you forget me till now? And I am passing away tonight?" The bishop saw that as if he was awake, he prayed on her the prayer for ordaining monks, and put on her the garb of monasticism. When he did not find a Kalansowa (cover for the head), he took off his own and put it on her head. Then he put on her the holy Eskeem. She had a silver cross in her hand which she gave to him saying, "Accept this cross from your disciple."

فرأى ذات ليلة القديسة ثاؤبستى فى شكل مُضئ وسمعها تقول: لماذا نسيتنى إلى الآن وأنا سأتنيح الليلة ؟. ورأى نفسه فى الحلم أنه قام من نومه وصلى عليها صلاة الرهبنة وألبسها ثوبها ، ولما لم يجد قلنسوة خلع قلنسوته وألبسها لها ثم وشحها بالإسكيم المقدس وكان بيدها صليب من الفضة ناولته له قائلة: إقبل من تلميذتك هذا الصليب.
Immediately the Bishop woke up from his sleep and found the cross in his hand and he looked attentively at the cross which was beautifully made. He was amazed and glorified God.
Immediately the Bishop woke up from his sleep and found the cross in his hand and he looked attentively at the cross which was beautifully made. He was amazed and glorified God.
وللحال إستيقظ الأب الأسقف من نومه فوجد الصليب بيده فتعجب ومجد الله.

He went with his disciple to the house of this saint. He found her son sitting besides her room crying. When he asked him why he was crying, he replied saying, "My mother called me in the middle of the night and bid me farewell and told me that she is departing tonight to go to the Lord Christ, then she commanded me saying: `Whatever the bishop tells you, do it and do not break it.’ Then she departed in peace.”

He went with his disciple to the house of this saint. He found her son sitting besides her room crying. When he asked him why he was crying, he replied saying, "My mother called me in the middle of the night and bid me farewell and told me that she is departing tonight to go to the Lord Christ, then she commanded me saying: `Whatever the bishop tells you, do it and do not break it.’ Then she departed in peace.”

ثم قام ومضى هو وتلميذه إلى بيت القديسة فوجد إبنها جالساً يبكى. ولما سأله عن سبب بكائه فقال إن والدتى إستدعتنى نحو نصف الليل وقالت لى: سأتنيح الليلة وأمضى إلى السيد المسيح. ثم أوصتنى قائلة: إحفظ جميع ما يشير به عليك الأب الأسقف. ثم تنيحت بسلام.

When the bishop heard this, he came to the room of the saint and knocked on the door, and called on her but she did not answer. He said, "This blessed saint had departed indeed," and he ordered his disciple to open the door. When the bishop entered, he found that she had already departed. She had on the Eskeem that he had put on her in his vision and also the Kalansowa that he had on. He realized that what he had seen in his sleep was a reality.

When the bishop heard this, he came to the room of the saint and knocked on the door, and called on her but she did not answer. He said, "This blessed saint had departed indeed," and he ordered his disciple to open the door. When the bishop entered, he found that she had already departed. She had on the Eskeem that he had put on her in his vision and also the Kalansowa that he had on. He realized that what he had seen in his sleep was a reality.
فلما سمع الأب الأسقف ذلك ، أتى إلى حجرة القديسة وقرع الباب وناداها فلم تجيبه فتاكد من نياحتها. فأمر تلميذه بكسر باب الحجرة ، ولما دخل وجدها متوشحة بالإسكيم كعادة الراهبات.

His eyes were filled with tears. He praised and glorified God who works out the satisfaction of His saints. The bishop shrouded her by his own hands as was the custom of the nuns and ordered to carry her to the holy church where he prayed over her.

His eyes were filled with tears. He praised and glorified God who works out the satisfaction of His saints. The bishop shrouded her by his own hands as was the custom of the nuns and ordered to carry her to the holy church where he prayed over her.
وبعد ذلك أمر أن يحملوها إلى الكنيسة حيث صلى عليها.

There was in the city a paralytic infidel man, suffering from evil spirits. He asked his people to carry him and take him where the body of the saint was. When they brought him to the church, he drew near to the holy body with faith and he was cured instantly. The devil came out of him, and was able to walk well. He and his entire household believed in the Lord Christ and the bishop baptized them.

There was in the city a paralytic infidel man, suffering from evil spirits. He asked his people to carry him and take him where the body of the saint was. When they brought him to the church, he drew near to the holy body with faith and he was cured instantly. The devil came out of him, and was able to walk well. He and his entire household believed in the Lord Christ and the bishop baptized them.
وكان يوجد بالمدينة رجل وثنى مُقعد من أرواح شريرة ، فقربوه من جسدها فشفى لوقته وخرج منه الشيطان وقام يمشى صحيحاً مُعافي. فأمن لوقته بالسيد المسيح هو وكل بيته وإعتمدوا جميعاً.
And everyone who had a disease or a deformity would come to the church and touch the holy body and would be healed.
And everyone who had a disease or a deformity would come to the church and touch the holy body and would be healed.
وكان كثيرون من المرضى وذوى العاهات يأتون إلى البيعة ويلمسون الجسد الطاهر فينالون الشفاء.
The blessing of her prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of her prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلاتها فلتكن معنا أمين.

Title.language: The Departure of Pope Athanasius the Second, the Twenty-Eighth Patriarch of the See of St. Mark
The Departure of Pope Athanasius the Second, the Twenty-Eighth Patriarch of the See of St. Mark
نياحة البابا أثناسيوس الثانى البطريرك الثامن والعشرين من بطاركة الكرازة المرقسية

text.language: On this day also of the year 213 of the martyrs (496 A.D.), the blessed father Anba Athanasius II, 28th patriarch of the See of St. Mark, departed. This father was the steward of the churches of Alexandria. When Pope Peter III, the 27th patriarch, departed, the bishops, elders and people agreed to consecrate this father, Patriarch for what was known of his Orthodox faith and piety.

On this day also of the year 213 of the martyrs (496 A.D.), the blessed father Anba Athanasius II, 28th patriarch of the See of St. Mark, departed. This father was the steward of the churches of Alexandria. When Pope Peter III, the 27th patriarch, departed, the bishops, elders and people agreed to consecrate this father, Patriarch for what was known of his Orthodox faith and piety.

وفى مثل هذا اليوم أيضاً من سنة 213 للشهداء (496 م ) تنيح الأب المغبوط الأنبا أثناسيوس الثانى البطريرك الثامن والعشرون من بطاركة الكرازة المرقسية. وقد كان هذا الآب وكيلاً على كنائس الإسكندرية. فلما تنيح البابا بطرس الثالث البطريرك السابع والعشرون ، إتفق رأى الآباء الأساقفة والأراخنة على تقديم هذا الأب بطريركاً لما عُرف عنه من الصلاح وأستقامة الإيمان.

He was called Athanasius, the Less, to identify him from St. Athanasius the Apostolic, and that was during the reign of Emperor Zeno. This father participated with Emperor Anastasius, who came after Zeno, to re-establish the peace between the churches of the East after being disrupted by the Council of Chalcedon.

He was called Athanasius, the Less, to identify him from St. Athanasius the Apostolic, and that was during the reign of Emperor Zeno. This father participated with Emperor Anastasius, who came after Zeno, to re-establish the peace between the churches of the East after being disrupted by the Council of Chalcedon.

وقد دعى بأسم أثناسيوس الصغير تمييزاً له عن القديس أثناسيوس الرسولى. وكان ذلك فى أيام الإمبراطور زينون. وقد إشترك هذا الأب مع أنسطاسيوس قيصر الذى جاء بعد زينون فى إعادة السلام بين كنائس الشرق بعدما مزق مجمع خلقدونية الكنيسة.
The time of this Pope was peaceful and tranquil. He shepherd his people in purity and righteousness then departed in peace. He sat on the throne of St. Mark for seven years.
The time of this Pope was peaceful and tranquil. He shepherd his people in purity and righteousness then departed in peace. He sat on the throne of St. Mark for seven years.
وعاش هذا البابا فترة هدوء وسلام راعياً شعبه بالبر والإستقامة ثم تنيح بسلام. وكانت مدة جلوسه على الكرسى المرقسى حوالى سبع سنين.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلاته فلتكن معنا أمين .

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Melitina the Virgin
The Martyrdom of St. Melitina the Virgin
إستشهاد القديسة ملاتينى العذراء

text.language: On this day also the church celebrates the commemoration of the martyrdom of St. Melitina the Virgin.
On this day also the church celebrates the commemoration of the martyrdom of St. Melitina the Virgin.
وفى مثل هذا اليوم تعيد الكنيسة بتذكار استشهاد القديسة ملاتينى العذراء.
The blessing of her prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen
The blessing of her prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen
بركة صلواتها فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. أمين.

Title.language: The Twenty-First Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Twenty-First Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الحادى والعشرين من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the twenty-first day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the twenty-first day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الحادى والعشرين من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Commemoration of the Virgin St. Mary, the Theotokos
The Commemoration of the Virgin St. Mary, the Theotokos
تذكار والدة الإله القديسة مريم

text.language: The holy church had arranged to celebrate on the 21st day of each Coptic month a commemoration of the pure Lady, the Virgin St. Mary, the “Theotokos.” During her earthly life and on the 21st day of the month of Paone, she performed the miracle of melting (dissolution) of the iron and rescuing the Apostle St. Matthias from prison. Her departure was also on the 21st of the month of Tubah. Some of the fathers the apostles also consecrated the first church after her name in the city of Philippi on the 21st of the month of Baounah and that was after her departure.

The holy church had arranged to celebrate on the 21st day of each Coptic month a commemoration of the pure Lady, the Virgin St. Mary, the “Theotokos.” During her earthly life and on the 21st day of the month of Paone, she performed the miracle of melting (dissolution) of the iron and rescuing the Apostle St. Matthias from prison. Her departure was also on the 21st of the month of Tubah. Some of the fathers the apostles also consecrated the first church after her name in the city of Philippi on the 21st of the month of Baounah and that was after her departure.

رتبت الكنيسة المقدسة أن تعُيد فى اليوم الحادى والعشرين من كل شهر قبطى بتذكار والدة الإله القديسة الطاهرة مريم العذراء. كما أن القديسة العذراء صنعت معجزة حل الحديد وأنقذت القديس متياس الرسول من السجن فى اليوم الحادى والعشرين من شهر بؤونة أثناء حياتها على الأرض. وقد قام بعض الآباء الرسل بتكريس أول كنيسة بإسمها فى مدينة فيليبى فى اليوم الحادى والعشرين من شهر بؤونة بعد نياحتها.
Her intercession be with us all. Amen.
Her intercession be with us all. Amen.
بركة شفاعتها المقدسة فلتكن معنا. أمين .

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Cyprian (Cyprianus) the Bishop and St. Justina
The Martyrdom of St. Cyprian (Cyprianus) the Bishop and St. Justina
إستشهاد القديس كبريانوس الأسقف والقديسة يوستينة

text.language: On this day also of the year 257 A.D. the honorable bishop St. Cyprian (Cyprianus) and St. Justina, were martyred. Cyprianus was from the city of Antioch from a rich and well educated family. He received a great deal of knowledge and education and he pursued his studies in the arts of magic until he excelled in them. The pagans came to him to help them deal with their problems with his magic.

On this day also of the year 257 A.D. the honorable bishop St. Cyprian (Cyprianus) and St. Justina, were martyred. Cyprianus was from the city of Antioch from a rich and well educated family. He received a great deal of knowledge and education and he pursued his studies in the arts of magic until he excelled in them. The pagans came to him to help them deal with their problems with his magic.

وفى مثل هذا اليوم من سنة ٢٥٧م أستشهد الأسقف القديس كبريانوس والقديسة يوستينا. كان هذا القديس من مدينة إنطاكية من أسرة أشُتهرت بالغنى والعلم ، فنال قسطاً وافراً من العلوم ، ثم عكف على دراسةعلوم السحر حتى نبغ فيها. فكان الوثنيون يلجأون إليه ليستعينوا بسحره.

In Antioch there was a very beautiful girl called Justina which means the little. She had believed in the Christian faith along with her parents. Her heart was kindled with the love of Christ so she vowed her virginity to the Lord. She went to the church regularly, and a young man saw her and was fond of her. He was not able to obtain what he desired from her for she persevered on prayer and fasting so the Lord would keep her a pure bride for Him.

In Antioch there was a very beautiful girl called Justina which means the little. She had believed in the Christian faith along with her parents. Her heart was kindled with the love of Christ so she vowed her virginity to the Lord. She went to the church regularly, and a young man saw her and was fond of her. He was not able to obtain what he desired from her for she persevered on prayer and fasting so the Lord would keep her a pure bride for Him.

وكانت فى أنطاكية فتاة بارعة الجمال تدعى يوستينة ، دخلت إلى الإيمان المسيحى مع والديها وإشتعل قلبها بمحبة المسيح حتى نذرت بتوليتها للمسيح وكانت تواظب على الذهاب إلى الكنيسة فأعجب بها أحد الشبان ولم يستطع أن ينال بغيته منها بل كانت تواظب على الصوم والصلاة لكى يحفظها الله عروساً للمسيح.

When this young man gave up all hope, he went to Cyprian the sorcerer entreating him to fulfill his desire of her. Cyprian promised him to use all his magic to fulfill his wish. Nevertheless, all his efforts failed, for every time he sent to her demonic powers they find her standing praying, so they go back to him defeated.

When this young man gave up all hope, he went to Cyprian the sorcerer entreating him to fulfill his desire of her. Cyprian promised him to use all his magic to fulfill his wish. Nevertheless, all his efforts failed, for every time he sent to her demonic powers they find her standing praying, so they go back to him defeated.

فلما يئس ذلك الشاب لجأ إلى كبريانوس الساحر متوسلاً إليه أن يحقق له أمله من يوستينة فوعده كبريانوس بذلك. وبدأ يعمل جهده بالسحر فذهبت كل جهوده أدراج الرياح. وكان كلما يرسل إليها قوة شيطانية يجدونها قائمة تصلى فيعودون له بالخيبة.

When Cyprian failed, he called the demons and told them, "If you do not bring Justina to me, I shall adopt Christianity." The Devil thought out a device to deceive him. He ordered one of his soldiers to disguise himself and to take the form of Justina and then go to Cyprian. He hastened and made it known to Cyprian her coming, so he rejoiced and waited for her. Then Satan, disguised as Justina, came to him, and Cyprianus rejoiced, and rose up to embrace her. Because of his great joy in her, he told her, "Welcome, Queen of women, Justina." Upon the mere mention of her name, Satan, disguised as her, disappeared like smoke. Cyprianus knew that this was a deceitful trick of Satan who could not stand before the mentioning of her name.

When Cyprian failed, he called the demons and told them, "If you do not bring Justina to me, I shall adopt Christianity." The Devil thought out a device to deceive him. He ordered one of his soldiers to disguise himself and to take the form of Justina and then go to Cyprian. He hastened and made it known to Cyprian her coming, so he rejoiced and waited for her. Then Satan, disguised as Justina, came to him, and Cyprianus rejoiced, and rose up to embrace her. Because of his great joy in her, he told her, "Welcome, Queen of women, Justina." Upon the mere mention of her name, Satan, disguised as her, disappeared like smoke. Cyprianus knew that this was a deceitful trick of Satan who could not stand before the mentioning of her name.

When Cyprian realized the weakness of the devils before the power of prayers and faith in the Lord Christ, he devoted himself in studying the Christian religion. He recognized the great difference between Christianity and pagan philosophy. The Holy Spirit worked in his heart and he believed in the Lord Christ. Immediately Cyprian rose up and burnt his books of magic, and was baptized by the patriarch of Antioch. He started in true repentance to pray and fast, devoting his time for worship. He sold all his possessions and distributed them among the poor and the needy.

When Cyprian realized the weakness of the devils before the power of prayers and faith in the Lord Christ, he devoted himself in studying the Christian religion. He recognized the great difference between Christianity and pagan philosophy. The Holy Spirit worked in his heart and he believed in the Lord Christ. Immediately Cyprian rose up and burnt his books of magic, and was baptized by the patriarch of Antioch. He started in true repentance to pray and fast, devoting his time for worship. He sold all his possessions and distributed them among the poor and the needy.

ولما رأى كبريانوس ضعف الشياطين أمام قوة الصلاة والإيمان بالسيد المسيح عكف بكل قواه على دراسة المسيحية. فآمن بالسيد المسيح وجمع كتب السحر وأحرقها ومضى إلى بطريرك إنطاكية وتعمد على يده وصار مسيحياً غيوراً وبدأ بأعمال التوبةالصادقة والأصوام الكثيرة ، ثم باع كل ماله ووزعه على الفقراء وتفرغ للعبادة.

Later on the Patriarch of Antioch ordained him a deacon then priest. When he saw his advancement in piety and virtues, the patriarch consecrated him a bishop, so he increased in grace and service. St. Cyprian sought St. Justina and built a convent for her where she lived and became the mother of many virgins.

Later on the Patriarch of Antioch ordained him a deacon then priest. When he saw his advancement in piety and virtues, the patriarch consecrated him a bishop, so he increased in grace and service. St. Cyprian sought St. Justina and built a convent for her where she lived and became the mother of many virgins.

وبعد قليل رسمه بطريرك إنطاكية شماساً ثم قساً. ولما رأى نموه فى التقوى والفضيلة رفعه إلى رتبة الأسقفية. فازداد نعمة وخدمة ثم طلب القديسة يوستينا وبنى لها بيتاً للعذارى عاشت فيه وصارت أماً لعدد من العذارى.

When Diocletian incited persecution against the Christians, the Governor seized the holy bishop Cyprian and St. Justina and many Christians. When they came before the court they confessed the Lord Christ without hesitation. Justina was whipped severely with an ox tail and Cyprian was hung in the air and his body was torn with red hot iron rods. In spite of the sever torture they remained steadfast in the faith. They were sent to prison where they praised God for the honor of being tortured for the sake of the name of Christ.

When Diocletian incited persecution against the Christians, the Governor seized the holy bishop Cyprian and St. Justina and many Christians. When they came before the court they confessed the Lord Christ without hesitation. Justina was whipped severely with an ox tail and Cyprian was hung in the air and his body was torn with red hot iron rods. In spite of the sever torture they remained steadfast in the faith. They were sent to prison where they praised God for the honor of being tortured for the sake of the name of Christ.

ولما أثار دقلديانوس الاضطهاد على المسيحيين قبض الوالى على الأسقف القديس كبريانوس وعلى القديسة يوستينة وكثير من المسيحيين وساقهم إلى القضاء فأعترفوا بلا تردد بالسيد المسيح. فُجلدت يوستينة بعنف بأعصاب البقر أما كبريانوس فعلق فى الهواء ومزق جسده بأسياخ من حديد ورغم العذاب الشديد ظلا ثابتين على الإيمان بالسيد المسيح.
When the Governor became weary from torturing them, he sent them to Emperor Diocletian. When he knew their account, he ordered them beheaded, so they received the crown of martyrdom.
When the Governor became weary from torturing them, he sent them to Emperor Diocletian. When he knew their account, he ordered them beheaded, so they received the crown of martyrdom.

فأرسلوهما إلى السجن فلبث كل منهما يسبح الله على ما ناله من شرف الآلام من أجل إسم المسيح. ولما تعب الوالى من تعذيبهما أرسلهما إلى الإمبراطور دقلديانوس فى نيقوميديا ، فلما عرف قضيتهما أمر بقطع رأس كل منهما فنالا إكليل الشهادة.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen.
بركة صلواتهما فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. أمين .

Title.language: The Twenty-Second Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Twenty-Second Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الثانى والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the twenty-second day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the twenty-second day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الثانى والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of Saints Cotylas (Kobtlas) and Axoua, his Sister, and Tatas, his Friend
The Martyrdom of Saints Cotylas (Kobtlas) and Axoua, his Sister, and Tatas, his Friend
إستشهاد القديسين كوتلاس وإكسوا أخته وتاتاس صديقهما

text.language: On this day, Saints Cotylas (Kobtlas) and his sister Axoua, the children of Shapur (Sapor), King of Persia, and Cotylas' friend, Tatas, were martyred. King Shapur worshipped fire and the sun. He persecuted the believers in the Name of the Lord Christ in his kingdom. His son, Cotylas, had a friend named Tatas who was a ruler over one of the countries under the rule of Shapur.

On this day, Saints Cotylas (Kobtlas) and his sister Axoua, the children of Shapur (Sapor), King of Persia, and Cotylas' friend, Tatas, were martyred. King Shapur worshipped fire and the sun. He persecuted the believers in the Name of the Lord Christ in his kingdom. His son, Cotylas, had a friend named Tatas who was a ruler over one of the countries under the rule of Shapur.

فى مثل هذا اليوم إستشهد القديسون كوتلاس وإكسوا أخته إبنا سابور ملك الفرس وتاتاس صديقهما. وقد كان الملك سابور يعبد النار والشمس ويضطهد المؤمنين بإسم السيد المسيح فى بلاده . وكان تاتاس رئيساً على إحدى البلاد.

Certain evil people brought an accusation against Tatas before the king that he was a Christian. The king sent to him a governor named Tumakher (Tumansar) to verify his faith and if it was true, to torture him. When the prince Cotylas heard that, he also went to his friend Tatas. When the governor arrived and found that he was Christian, he ordered him be thrown into the fire. St. Tatas made the sign of the Cross over the fire and it was extinguished at once. Cotylas marveled and asked Tatas, "How did you learn this magic, 0 my brother?" He replied, "This is not magic but it is through faith in the Lord Christ." Cotylas asked, "If I believed, would I be able to do the same?" Tatas answered that with faith you can do even more than this. Cotylas, believed in the Lord Christ, then he drew near the fire and made the sign of the Cross over it, the fire backed a distance of 15 cubits.

Certain evil people brought an accusation against Tatas before the king that he was a Christian. The king sent to him a governor named Tumakher (Tumansar) to verify his faith and if it was true, to torture him. When the prince Cotylas heard that, he also went to his friend Tatas. When the governor arrived and found that he was Christian, he ordered him be thrown into the fire. St. Tatas made the sign of the Cross over the fire and it was extinguished at once. Cotylas marveled and asked Tatas, "How did you learn this magic, 0 my brother?" He replied, "This is not magic but it is through faith in the Lord Christ." Cotylas asked, "If I believed, would I be able to do the same?" Tatas answered that with faith you can do even more than this. Cotylas, believed in the Lord Christ, then he drew near the fire and made the sign of the Cross over it, the fire backed a distance of 15 cubits.

فوشى به بعض الأشرار عند الملك بأنه مسيحى. فأرسل إليه طوماخر الوالى ليتحقق من عقيدته ويعذبه إن كان الأمر صحيحاً. ولما سمع الأمير كوتلاس جاء إلى صديقه تاتاس الذى قبض عليه الوالى وأمر بطرحه فى أتون النار . فرشم تاتاس النار بعلامة الصليب فانطفأت للحال ، فتعجب الأمير كوتلاس وظن أن ذلك بفعل السحر. فأخبره تاتاس أنه بفعل الإيمان بالسيد المسيح. فقال له الأمير هل أستطيع أن أفعل هكذا إذا آمنت ، فأجابه: بل وتفعل وأكثر من هذا. فآمن كوتلاس بالسيد المسيح ثم تقدم إلى النار ورشمها بعلامةالصليب فرجعت خمسة عشر ذراعاً.
The governor wrote to the king to inform him what had happened. The king brought them and ordered to behead Tatas, so he received the crown of martyrdom.
The governor wrote to the king to inform him what had happened. The king brought them and ordered to behead Tatas, so he received the crown of martyrdom.
فكتب الوالى إلى الملك يعرفه بالأمر فإستدعى الملك الإثنين وأمر سيافاً فقطع رأس تاتاس ونال إكليل الشهادة.

However, he tortured his son, Cotylas, with different kinds of tortures. Then he cast him in prison and sent to him his sister Axoua, so she might persuade him to abandon his belief. St. Cotylas preached her and turned her heart to the faith in the Lord Christ. He sent her to a priest who baptized her secretly.

However, he tortured his son, Cotylas, with different kinds of tortures. Then he cast him in prison and sent to him his sister Axoua, so she might persuade him to abandon his belief. St. Cotylas preached her and turned her heart to the faith in the Lord Christ. He sent her to a priest who baptized her secretly.
أما كوتلاس فعذبه بأنواع العذاب ثم طرحه فى السجن ، وأرسل له إكسوا أخته لكى تثنيه عن عزمه فوعظها وأمال قلبها إلى الإيمان بالسيد المسيح. وأرسلها لأحد الكهنة فعمدها سراً.
She returned to her father saying, "I wish that you had what my brother and I have, for there is no God but Jesus Christ." The king was enraged and commanded to torture her
She returned to her father saying, "I wish that you had what my brother and I have, for there is no God but Jesus Christ." The king was enraged and commanded to torture her
وعادت إلى أبيها تقول: ليتك يا أبى تحصل على ما حصلت عليه أنا وأخى فأنه ليس إله إلا يسوع المسيح. فغضب الملك وسلمها إلى المعذبين أيضاً فعذبوها
until she yielded up Soul and received the crown of martyrdom.
until she yielded up Soul and received the crown of martyrdom.
حتى فاضت روحها الطاهرة ونالت إكليل الشهادة.

They tied Cotylas to the tails of horses and dragged him over the mountains, until he yielded up his spirit and received the crown of martyrdom. Then they cut his body into pieces and they cast it out for the birds to consume it. When the soldiers departed, the Lord commanded a saintly priest and a deacon who went secretly at night and took the holy body which was shining as snow. They hid it in a place until the end of the days of persecution.

They tied Cotylas to the tails of horses and dragged him over the mountains, until he yielded up his spirit and received the crown of martyrdom. Then they cut his body into pieces and they cast it out for the birds to consume it. When the soldiers departed, the Lord commanded a saintly priest and a deacon who went secretly at night and took the holy body which was shining as snow. They hid it in a place until the end of the days of persecution.

أما كوتلاس فربطوه في أذيال الخيل وإنطلقوا به فوق الجبال إلى أن أسلم الروح. ثم قطعوا جسده وألقوه هناك لتأكله طيور السماء. ولما أنصرف الجنود أوحى الرب يسوع الي كاهن قديس وشماس ، فمضوا خفية في الليل وأخذوا الجسد وأخفوه في مكان إلي إنقضاء زمن الإضطهاد.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلواتهم هؤلاء القديسين فلتكن معنا آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Julius of Aqfahs (El-Akfehasi), the Writer of the Biography of Martyrs, and his companions
The Martyrdom of St. Julius of Aqfahs (El-Akfehasi), the Writer of the Biography of Martyrs, and his companions
إستشهاد القديس يوليوس الأقفهصى كاتب سير الشهداء ومن معه

text.language: On this day also, St. Julius of Aqfahs (El-Akfehasi), the biographer of the martyrs, was himself martyred. He was born in Aqfahs and when he grew up he went to Alexandria to live there. It was during the persecution that was incited by Emperor Diocletian and his comrades against the Christians and especially against the Copts of Egypt, for their devotion to their faith in the Lord Christ, and their disobedience to the orders of the Emperor to worship the idols.

On this day also, St. Julius of Aqfahs (El-Akfehasi), the biographer of the martyrs, was himself martyred. He was born in Aqfahs and when he grew up he went to Alexandria to live there. It was during the persecution that was incited by Emperor Diocletian and his comrades against the Christians and especially against the Copts of Egypt, for their devotion to their faith in the Lord Christ, and their disobedience to the orders of the Emperor to worship the idols.

وفي مثل هذا اليوم أيضاً إستشهاد القديس يوليوس الأقفهصى كاتب سير الشهداء ومن معه. وقد وُلد هذا القديس في أقفهص وهى قرية مازالت بنفس إسمها تابعة لمركز الفشن محافظة بنى سويف. ولما كبر ذهب لمدينة الإسكندرية وسكن فيها. وكان ذلك أثناء الاضطهاد الذى أثاره دقلديانوس وأعوانه على المسيحيين بصفة عامة وعلى أقباط مصر بصفة خاصة لتمسكهم بالإيمان المسيحي وعدم طاعتهم لأوامر الملك بعبادة الأوثان .

Julius (Julian) El-Akfehasi was very rich in possessions and wealth. The Lord Christ appointed him to care for the bodies of the holy martyrs, shroud them and send them to their hometown. He ministered to the holy martyrs by himself and he used also 300 young men for this purpose. He supplied them with funds and delegated them to travel to different parts of the country. They wrote the biography of the martyrs, shrouded, and buried them. The Lord distracted the governors, so no one objected or captured him. They also never forced him to worship idols. The Lord kept him for this noble ministry to serve the Saints and to write their biography as a remembrance for the future generations. The martyrs, whom he served, blessed him, saying, "You must shed your blood in the Name of our Lord Christ, so you would also be counted among the martyrs."

Julius (Julian) El-Akfehasi was very rich in possessions and wealth. The Lord Christ appointed him to care for the bodies of the holy martyrs, shroud them and send them to their hometown. He ministered to the holy martyrs by himself and he used also 300 young men for this purpose. He supplied them with funds and delegated them to travel to different parts of the country. They wrote the biography of the martyrs, shrouded, and buried them. The Lord distracted the governors, so no one objected or captured him. They also never forced him to worship idols. The Lord kept him for this noble ministry to serve the Saints and to write their biography as a remembrance for the future generations. The martyrs, whom he served, blessed him, saying, "You must shed your blood in the Name of our Lord Christ, so you would also be counted among the martyrs."

كان يوليوس الأقفهصى غنياً جداً بالأموال والمقتنيات وقد إستخدمه السيد المسيح للعناية بأجساد الشهداء وتكفينهم وإرسالهم إلى بلادهم. وكان يفعل ذلك بنفسه كما كان له ثلاثمائة غلام كاتب زودهم بالأموال وكلفهم بالسفر لكتابة سير الشهداء وتكفينهم ودفنهم. وقد أنزل الله سهوا على قلوب الولاة فلم يمسكوه لأن الله حفظه سالماً لغاية حسنة وهى خدمة القديسين وكتابة سيرهم تذكاراً للأجيال القادمة. وكان الشهداء الذين يخدمهم يدعون له قائلين : لابد لك من سفك دمك على إسم السيد المسيح لتحسب فى عداد الشهداء أيضاً.

When the Lord Christ wished to fulfill what the saints had prophesied to St. Julius; and to relieve him from the toil of this world, He appeared to him in a vision at night. The Lord commanded him to go to Arkadius (Arfaniyous ), the governor of Samanoud, and to confess the Lord Christ before him. St. Julius went there as the Lord commanded him, and the governor severely tortured him with different kinds of tortures, but the Lord strengthened him. The governor ordered to bring him to worship the idols. The saint prayed and the earth was opened and swallowed up the 70 idols and the 40 priests who were serving them. When the governor witnessed the destruction of his idols and their priests, he believed in the Lord Christ.

When the Lord Christ wished to fulfill what the saints had prophesied to St. Julius; and to relieve him from the toil of this world, He appeared to him in a vision at night. The Lord commanded him to go to Arkadius (Arfaniyous ), the governor of Samanoud, and to confess the Lord Christ before him. St. Julius went there as the Lord commanded him, and the governor severely tortured him with different kinds of tortures, but the Lord strengthened him. The governor ordered to bring him to worship the idols. The saint prayed and the earth was opened and swallowed up the 70 idols and the 40 priests who were serving them. When the governor witnessed the destruction of his idols and their priests, he believed in the Lord Christ.

ولما أراد السيد المسيح أن يتمم ما أنبأه به القديسون ويريحه من أتعاب هذا العالم ظهر له فى رؤيا الليل وأمره أن يذهب إلى أركاديوس والى سمنود ويعترف أمامه بالسيد المسيح. فانطلق إلى هناك كأمر الرب فعذبه الوالى عذابات شديدة بأنواع مختلفة وكان الرب يقويه وحدث أن صلى صلاة قوية ففتحت الأرض فاها وإبتلعت سبعين وثناً وأربعين كاهنا ًكانوا يخدمون أمامها. فلما رأى الوالى هلاك الكهنة وزوال الآلهة آمن هو أيضاً بالسيد المسيح ثم مضى مع القديس إلى والى أتريب الذى عذبهما كثيراً.

The governor went with St. Julius to the governor of Athribis who tortured them much. The Saint prayed, and the Lord sent His angel who cut the heads of the idols, and blackened their faces with ashes, in the temple. The governor of Athribis and a large number of people believed in the Lord Christ.

The governor went with St. Julius to the governor of Athribis who tortured them much. The Saint prayed, and the Lord sent His angel who cut the heads of the idols, and blackened their faces with ashes, in the temple. The governor of Athribis and a large number of people believed in the Lord Christ.

ولما أراد السيد المسيح أن يتمم ما أنبأه به القديسون ويريحه من أتعاب هذا العالم ظهر له فى رؤيا الليل وأمره أن يذهب إلى أركاديوس والى سمنود ويعترف أمامه بالسيد المسيح. فانطلق إلى هناك كأمر الرب فعذبه الوالى عذابات شديدة بأنواع مختلفة وكان الرب يقويه وحدث أن صلى صلاة قوية ففتحت الأرض فاها وإبتلعت سبعين وثناً وأربعين كاهنا ًكانوا يخدمون أمامها. فلما رأى الوالى هلاك الكهنة وزوال الآلهة آمن هو أيضاً بالسيد المسيح.

The Saint then went to Iskandaros the governor of the city of Towa along with the governor of Samanoud and the governor of Athribis. First he refrained from torturing them, but later on he gave his order to cut off their heads. Julius and his two sons, Tadros and Yunias (Yougyas ); his slaves; and the governors of Samanoud and Athribis and many people numbered 1500 were martyred and received the crowns of martyrdom. The believers relocated the body of St. Julius El-Akfehasi with the bodies of his two sons to Alexandria.

The Saint then went to Iskandaros the governor of the city of Towa along with the governor of Samanoud and the governor of Athribis. First he refrained from torturing them, but later on he gave his order to cut off their heads. Julius and his two sons, Tadros and Yunias (Yougyas ); his slaves; and the governors of Samanoud and Athribis and many people numbered 1500 were martyred and received the crowns of martyrdom. The believers relocated the body of St. Julius El-Akfehasi with the bodies of his two sons to Alexandria.

ثم مضى مع القديس إلى والى أتريب الذى عذبهما كثيراً. ولما صلى القديس أرسل الرب ملاكه إلى بربا الأصنام فنزع رؤوس الأصنام وسودها بالرماد فآمن والى أتريب أيضاً على يدى القديس يوليوس. ثم ذهب ثلاثتهم إلى ألكسندروس والى طوه. فكتب قضيتهم وأمر الجند فقطعوا رؤسهم وكان معهم إبنا يوليوس تادرس ويونياس وعبيده وجماعة عظيمة كان عددها نحو ألف وخمسمائة شخص إستشهدوا جميعهم ونالوا إكاليل الشهادة. نقل المؤمنون جسد القديس يوليوس الأقفهصى مع جسدي إبنيه إلى الإسكندرية.

When the era of persecution ended, and the righteous Emperor Constantine reigned, he heard about the biography of the great martyr St. Julius El-Akfehasi and admired his courage. He sent much money to Egypt and ordered to build a church after his name in the city of Alexandria. After the building of the church his body was relocated to it and was consecrated by Pope Alexandros, the 19th Pope of Alexandria on the 25th of Babah.

When the era of persecution ended, and the righteous Emperor Constantine reigned, he heard about the biography of the great martyr St. Julius El-Akfehasi and admired his courage. He sent much money to Egypt and ordered to build a church after his name in the city of Alexandria. After the building of the church his body was relocated to it and was consecrated by Pope Alexandros, the 19th Pope of Alexandria on the 25th of Babah.

ولما أنتهى الاضطهاد وتولى الملك البار قسطنطين زمام الأمبراطورية سمع بسيرة الشهيد العظيم يوليوس الأقفهصي فأعجب جداً بشجاعته. وأرسل أموالاً إلى مصر وأمر بأن تبُنى بإسمه كنيسة فى مدينة الإسكندرية فبُنيت ونقُل جسده إليها. وكرزها البابا البطريرك ألكسندروس البطريرك التاسع عشر فى 25 بابة.
The blessing of these holy martyrs be with us all, and Glory be to our God, forever. Amen.
The blessing of these holy martyrs be with us all, and Glory be to our God, forever. Amen.
بركة صلوات هؤلاء الشهداء القديسون فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Twenty-Third Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Twenty-Third Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الثالث والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the twenty-third day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the twenty-third day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الثالث والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of Sts. Eunapius (Onanius) and Andrew his Brother
The Martyrdom of Sts. Eunapius (Onanius) and Andrew his Brother
إستشهاد القديسين البارين أونانيوس وأندراوس أخيه

text.language: On this day of the year 79 of the martyrs (363 A.D.), the two righteous Sts. Eunapius (Onanius) and Andrew, his brother, were martyred. These saints were the sons of one of the nobles of the city of Lydda, in Palestine.

On this day of the year 79 of the martyrs (363 A.D.), the two righteous Sts. Eunapius (Onanius) and Andrew, his brother, were martyred. These saints were the sons of one of the nobles of the city of Lydda, in Palestine.
فى مثل هذا اليوم من سنة 79 للشهداء (363 م) أستشهد القديسان الباران أونانيوس وأندراوس أخوه. كان هذان القديسان إبنين لأحد أكابر مدينة لدَّة بفلسطين.

They agreed together since their young age on the monastic life. They went to one of the monasteries of Syria where they became monks. Shortly after, they went to the great saint Abba Macarius in the wilderness of Scetis. They became his disciples for thirty years. During which they lived with love and humility, fasted and prayed continually. Their asceticism and knowledge became well known. They chose Onanius, bishop, and Andrew, a priest. They shepherd the flock of Christ with the best of care.

They agreed together since their young age on the monastic life. They went to one of the monasteries of Syria where they became monks. Shortly after, they went to the great saint Abba Macarius in the wilderness of Scetis. They became his disciples for thirty years. During which they lived with love and humility, fasted and prayed continually. Their asceticism and knowledge became well known. They chose Onanius, bishop, and Andrew, a priest. They shepherd the flock of Christ with the best of care.

فأتفقا منذ صباهما على عيشة الرهبنة. فأنطلقا إلى أحد أديرة الشام وترهبا هناك. وبعد قليل قصدا القديس مكاريوس الكبير ببرية شيهيت وتتلمذا له مدة ثلاثين عاماً أمضياها فى الأصوام والصلوات والإتضاع والمحبة. ولما شاع خبر نسكهما وعلمهما تم إختيار أونانيوس أسقفاً وأندراوس قساً. فرعيا رعية المسيح أحسن رعاية.

Julian, the infidel emperor, heard about them, and he had them brought to him. He tried to persuade them to deny their faith in the Lord Christ, but they refused. He tortured them severely and when he failed to turn them away from their faith he commanded to behead them. Each received three crowns: one for monasticism, the second for the priesthood and service and a third one for witnessing to the Lord Christ (martyrdom).

Julian, the infidel emperor, heard about them, and he had them brought to him. He tried to persuade them to deny their faith in the Lord Christ, but they refused. He tortured them severely and when he failed to turn them away from their faith he commanded to behead them. Each received three crowns: one for monasticism, the second for the priesthood and service and a third one for witnessing to the Lord Christ (martyrdom).

ولما سمع بهما الإمبراطور يوليانوس الجاحد إستحضرهما وحاول أن يردهما عن الإيمان بالسيد المسيح ولما عجز عن ذلك أصدر أمراً بقطع رأسيهما. فنال كل منهما ثلاثة أكاليل واحداً من أجل الرهبنة والثانى من أجل الكهنوت والخدمة والثالث من أجل الشهادة للمسيح.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلاتهما فلتكن معنا. آمين.

Title.language: The Commemoration of the Martyr St. Thecla
The Commemoration of the Martyr St. Thecla
تذكار القديسة الشهيدة تكلا

text.language: On this day also the church celebrates the commemoration of the first female martyr, St. Thecla (Takla), the bride of Christ. She was a deaconess and disciple of the apostle Paul. She was an example of virginity and purity and a model for strife and enduring hardships.

On this day also the church celebrates the commemoration of the first female martyr, St. Thecla (Takla), the bride of Christ. She was a deaconess and disciple of the apostle Paul. She was an example of virginity and purity and a model for strife and enduring hardships.
وفيه أيضا تعيد الكنيسة بتذكار القديسة تكلا أولى الشهيدات الشماسة تلميذة بولس الرسول ، مثال البتولية والطهارة ونموذج الجهاد وإحتمال الشدائد.
Thecla was a native of Iconium, one of the cities of Asia Minor. Her parents were honorable and pagan. She was very beautiful and well mannered. Thecla was engaged to one of the nobles of that city.
Thecla was a native of Iconium, one of the cities of Asia Minor. Her parents were honorable and pagan. She was very beautiful and well mannered. Thecla was engaged to one of the nobles of that city.
ولدت تكلا فى مدينة أيقونية إحدى مدن آسيا الصغرى من أبوين شريفين وثنيين ، كانت بارعة الجمال وكريمة الخلق. وكانت قد خطبت لأحد أشراف تلك المدينة.

When St. Paul came to Iconium , in his first missionary journey, between 45 A.D. and 50 A.D., Thecla heard his preaching. She marveled at his teachings and followed him. She believed in the Lord Christ, was baptized, vowed her virginity to the Lord, and she broke off her engagement. The life of the saint changed after her believing in Christ. After she was concerned about her physical beauty she started to care for her spiritual adornment.

When St. Paul came to Iconium , in his first missionary journey, between 45 A.D. and 50 A.D., Thecla heard his preaching. She marveled at his teachings and followed him. She believed in the Lord Christ, was baptized, vowed her virginity to the Lord, and she broke off her engagement. The life of the saint changed after her believing in Christ. After she was concerned about her physical beauty she started to care for her spiritual adornment.

وعندما وصل القديس بولس الرسول إلى أيقونية فى رحلته التبشيرية الأولى بين عامى 45- 50 م وسمعته تكلا أعجبت بتعاليمه جداً فلازمته ثم آمنت بالسيد المسيح وإعتمدت ونذرت بتوليتها للرب وهجرت خطيبها. وتبدلت حياة القديسة بعد الإيمان فبعد أن كانت تهتم بزينة الجسد بدأت تهتم بزينة الروح.

Her mother noticed the change in her behavior. She asked her about the secret for the change, Thecla told her that she became Christian and she had vowed her virginity to the Lord Christ. Her mother was enraged and tried to persuade her but she refused. The mother went to the governor of the city and asked for his assistance. He brought Thecla and tried to convince her to abandon Christianity and to return to the worship of the gods and to her fiancé. She utterly refused and did not heed his threats. Thecla was ordered burned to death, but a storm providentially extinguished the flames and she safely escaped death.

Her mother noticed the change in her behavior. She asked her about the secret for the change, Thecla told her that she became Christian and she had vowed her virginity to the Lord Christ. Her mother was enraged and tried to persuade her but she refused. The mother went to the governor of the city and asked for his assistance. He brought Thecla and tried to convince her to abandon Christianity and to return to the worship of the gods and to her fiancé. She utterly refused and did not heed his threats. Thecla was ordered burned to death, but a storm providentially extinguished the flames and she safely escaped death.

فلاحظت أمها هذا التغير الكبير فى سلوكها ولما سألتها عن سر ذلك ، قالت لها أنها أصبحت مسيحية وأنها نذرت بتوليتها للرب يسوع. فغضبت أمها وحاولت أقناعها فرفضت وهنا لجأت الأم إلى حاكم المدينة وإستعانت به. فإستحضر حاكم المدينة القديسة تكلا وحاول إقناعها بترك المسيحية والعودة إلى عبادة الآلهة وإلى عريسها فرفضت بشدة ولم تخف من تهديداته. فأمر بإضرام نار حامية وطرحها فيها فأرسل الرب مطراً غزيراً أطفأ النار وخرجت تكلا سالمة.

Later on she left her city, and went looking for St. Paul, who took her with him to the city of Antioch. He left her there to serve among the women. The governor of the city seized her, and cast her to the wild beasts, which did not harm her. Then he threw her into a pit full of poisonous snakes which also did not harm her, so he ordered to release her.

Later on she left her city, and went looking for St. Paul, who took her with him to the city of Antioch. He left her there to serve among the women. The governor of the city seized her, and cast her to the wild beasts, which did not harm her. Then he threw her into a pit full of poisonous snakes which also did not harm her, so he ordered to release her.

بعد ذلك تركت مدينتها وذهبت ساعيةٍ وراء الرسول بولس . فأخذها معه إلى مدينة إنطاكية وهناك تركها لتخدم بين النساء فقبض عليها الوالى هناك وطرحها للوحوش لكن الوحوش لم تضرها. ثم ألقاها فى الجب مليء بالأفاعى السامة فلم تؤذها أيضاً فأمر باطلاق سراحها.

St. Paul encouraged, strengthened her and sent her back to her birthplace Iconium to preach the people of her city with the life giving faith. When she realized that her mother still insisting and pressuring her on going back to paganism, she left Iconium. She went back to Tyre in Syria to pursue her ministry and many believed thru her.

St. Paul encouraged, strengthened her and sent her back to her birthplace Iconium to preach the people of her city with the life giving faith. When she realized that her mother still insisting and pressuring her on going back to paganism, she left Iconium. She went back to Tyre in Syria to pursue her ministry and many believed thru her.

وبعد ذلك شجعها القديس بولس وعزاها ثم رجعت إلى أيقونية مسقط رأسها لتبشر أهل مدينتها بالإيمان الحى. ولما وجدت أن أمها مازالت تضغط عليها وتحاول إرجاعها إلى الوثنية تركت أيقونية وعادت إلى صور بالشام لمتابعةخدمتها وهناك آمن على يديها شعب غفير.

In the later part of her life, she lived in seclusion in contemplation and asceticism. God granted her the gift of healing and many were cured with her prayers. Finally she reposed in the Lord and she was 90 years old. She was buried in Seleucia, the port of Antioch. The church calls her “the martyr without shedding blood.”

In the later part of her life, she lived in seclusion in contemplation and asceticism. God granted her the gift of healing and many were cured with her prayers. Finally she reposed in the Lord and she was 90 years old. She was buried in Seleucia, the port of Antioch. The church calls her “the martyr without shedding blood.”

وفى أواخر حياتها عكفت على الخلوة والتأمل والنسك وقد وهبها الله موهبة شفاء الأمراض. فنال كثيرون الشفاء بصلواتها. أخيراً رقدت فى الرب وهى فى سن التسعين ودفنت فى سلوكية ميناء إنطاكية وتدعوها الكنيسة (الشهيدة بدون سفك دم).
The blessing of her prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen
The blessing of her prayers be with us all and glory be to our God forever. Amen
بركة صلواتها فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Twenty-Fourth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Twenty-Fourth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الرابع والعشرون من شهر المبارك

text.language: Today is the twenty-fourth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the twenty-fourth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الرابع والعشرون من شهر المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Quadratus, One of the Seventy Disciples
The Martyrdom of St. Quadratus, One of the Seventy Disciples
إستشهاد القديس كودارتس أحد السبعين رسولاً

text.language: On this day was the martyrdom of St. Quadratus, one of the seventy apostles. He was born in the city of Athens, and was one of its great philosophers and learned nobles. When he believed in the Lord Christ, the Lord chose him to be one of His seventy apostles. Having received the grace of the Comforter on the day of Pentecost, he preached the life-giving Gospel in many countries. He enlightened their people with the faith of the Lord Christ and baptized them.

On this day was the martyrdom of St. Quadratus, one of the seventy apostles. He was born in the city of Athens, and was one of its great philosophers and learned nobles. When he believed in the Lord Christ, the Lord chose him to be one of His seventy apostles. Having received the grace of the Comforter on the day of Pentecost, he preached the life-giving Gospel in many countries. He enlightened their people with the faith of the Lord Christ and baptized them.

فى مثل هذا اليوم أستشهد القديس كودارتس أحد السبعين رسولاً. ولد هذا القديس بمدينة أثينا وكان من أعظم علمائها وفلاسفتها. ولما آمن بالسيد المسيح عينه الرب من ضمن السبعين رسولاً. ولما نال نعمة الروح القدس المعُزى فى يوم الخمسين إنطلق يبشر بالإنجيل فى بلاد كثيرة. فأنار أهلها بالإيمان ثم عمدهم.

Finally he returned to Athens, his birth place, to preach Christianity there also. They seized him and tortured him severely, then they cast him into the fire; thus, he received the crown of martyrdom.

Finally he returned to Athens, his birth place, to preach Christianity there also. They seized him and tortured him severely, then they cast him into the fire; thus, he received the crown of martyrdom.
وأخيراًعاد إلى مسقط رأسه أثينا وطفق يعلم فيها بالمسيحية فقبضوا عليه وعذبوه بأنواع كثيرة. ثم طرحوه فى النار فنال إكليل الشهادة.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن أمين .

Title.language: The Departure of St. Gregory, the Theologian
The Departure of St. Gregory, the Theologian
نياحة القديس غريغوريوس الثيئولوغوس

text.language: On this day also of the year 107 of the martyrs (391 A.D), St. Gregory of Nazianzus, the Theologian, departed. He was the son of Gregory bishop of Nazianzus.
On this day also of the year 107 of the martyrs (391 A.D), St. Gregory of Nazianzus, the Theologian, departed. He was the son of Gregory bishop of Nazianzus.
وفيه أيضاًمن سنة 107 للشهداء (٣٩١م) تنيح القديس غريغوريوس النزينزى الناطق بالإلهيات. وهو إبن غريغوريوس أسقف نزينز.

This saint was born in the year 328 A.D., in Arianzus a village in Cappadocia not far from Nazianzus. When he became a young man, his father sent him to schools in Caesarea of Cappadocia, Caesarea of Palestine, then in Alexandria and finally in Athens. He learned logic, poetry, philosophy, rhetoric, and theological subjects. He spent 12 years studying during which he befriended St Basil the Great. They both agreed on a life of devotion and monasticism.

This saint was born in the year 328 A.D., in Arianzus a village in Cappadocia not far from Nazianzus. When he became a young man, his father sent him to schools in Caesarea of Cappadocia, Caesarea of Palestine, then in Alexandria and finally in Athens. He learned logic, poetry, philosophy, rhetoric, and theological subjects. He spent 12 years studying during which he befriended St Basil the Great. They both agreed on a life of devotion and monasticism.

وُلد هذا القديس سنة ( 328م) فى بلدة إريانز ومن أعمال نزينز. ولما بلغ سن الشباب أرسله والده إلى مدارس قيصرية الكبادوك ثم إلى الإسكندرية ثم إلى أثينا. فتعلم المنطق والشعر والفصاحة والفلسفة والعلوم اللاهوتية. وقد أمضى فى ذلك إثنتى عشر سنة صادق خلالها القديس باسيليوس الكبير. واتفق كلاهما على حياةالتكريس.

When Gregory went back to his homeland, he assisted his father in pastoral care for he had become old. His father ordained him a presbyter in the year 361 A.D. When St. Basil was consecrated archbishop of Caesarea, Cappadocia, he consecrated his friend Gregory a bishop for Sasima in the year 372 A.D., nevertheless he could not go to his parish. For this parish was under dispute between St. Basil and the bishop Anthimus of Tyana. The soldiers of the Arian Emperor Valens prevented Gregory from entering his parish.

When Gregory went back to his homeland, he assisted his father in pastoral care for he had become old. His father ordained him a presbyter in the year 361 A.D. When St. Basil was consecrated archbishop of Caesarea, Cappadocia, he consecrated his friend Gregory a bishop for Sasima in the year 372 A.D., nevertheless he could not go to his parish. For this parish was under dispute between St. Basil and the bishop Anthimus of Tyana. The soldiers of the Arian Emperor Valens prevented Gregory from entering his parish.

ولما رجع غريغوريوس إلى وطنه ظل يساعد أباه فى أعمال الرعاية لأنه كان قد بلغ سن الشيخوخة فرسمه أبوه قساً سنة ( 361 م). ولما أرتقى القديس باسيليوس إلى رئاسةالكهنوت فى قيصريةالكبادوك رُسم صديقه غريغوريوس أسقفاً على سازيما سنة (٣٧٢م). لكنه لم يدخل الإيبارشية لأنها كانت موضع نزاع بين القديس باسيليوس والأسقف أنتيموس ومنعه جنود الإمبراطور فالنس الأريوسي من دخولها.

He returned to Nazianzus to assist his father in his episcopal duties. After the departure of his father in the year 374 A.D. he went to a monastery to live in seclusion for worship and contemplation for five years. Then he went to Constantinople in the year 379 A.D. for its Orthodox congregation urged him to come for the Arians had troubled them with their corrupt teachings. In Constantinople he returned many of the Arians to the Orthodox faith.

He returned to Nazianzus to assist his father in his episcopal duties. After the departure of his father in the year 374 A.D. he went to a monastery to live in seclusion for worship and contemplation for five years.
