Then he went to Constantinople in the year 379 A.D. for its Orthodox congregation urged him to come for the Arians had troubled them with their corrupt teachings. In Constantinople he returned many of the Arians to the Orthodox faith.

فعاد إلى نزينز ليساعد أباه فى أعمال الأسقفية وبعد نياحة والده سنة (٣٧٤م) مضى إلى دير منفرداً للعبادة والتأمل مدة خمس سنوات. وبعد ذلك ذهب إلى القسطنطينية سنة (379م) تحت إلحاح شعبها الأرثوذكسى الذى أتعبه الأريوسيون بتعاليمهم الفاسدة. وفي القسطنطينية رد كثيرين من الأريوسين إلى الإيمان المستقيم.

The intention was to confirm him a patriarch for Constantinople, but when the Second Ecumenical Council convened in the year 381 A.D., those who were assembled in the council studied the nomination. The Egyptian delegation objected this nomination for he was previously consecrated bishop for another parish. He left Constantinople after bedding the bishops and the congregation farewell in a very moving letter.

The intention was to confirm him a patriarch for Constantinople, but when the Second Ecumenical Council convened in the year 381 A.D., those who were assembled in the council studied the nomination. The Egyptian delegation objected this nomination for he was previously consecrated bishop for another parish. He left Constantinople after bedding the bishops and the congregation farewell in a very moving letter.

وكانت النية تتجه إلى تثبيته بطريركاً على القسطنطينية ولكن لما إجتمع المجمع المسكونى الثانى عام (٣٨١) بحث المجتمعون هذا الأمر فأعترض الوفد المصرى على هذا الأمر ، والسبب أنه سبقت رسامته على إيبارشية أخرى. فترك القسطنطينية بعد أن ودع الأساقفة والشعب بخطاب مؤثر للغاية.

Then he went back to Nazianzus to oppose the heresy of Apollinaris. Later on he lived in seclusion in Arianzus, his birth place, along with some hermits. He composed many articles contra Arians and other heresies. He also composed the Five Theological orations on the Divinity of the Logos which earned him the title, “The Theologian.” The Gregorian Liturgy is also attributed to him. Finally he was reposed in the Lord.

Then he went back to Nazianzus to oppose the heresy of Apollinaris. Later on he lived in seclusion in Arianzus, his birth place, along with some hermits. He composed many articles contra Arians and other heresies. He also composed the Five Theological orations on the Divinity of the Logos which earned him the title, “The Theologian.” The Gregorian Liturgy is also attributed to him. Finally he was reposed in the Lord.

وذهب إلى نزينز ليقاوم بدعة أبوليناريوس وبعدها أنفرد فى أريانز مع بعض النُسٌاك حيث ألف رسائل عديدة ضد الأريوسية وغيرها من الهرطقات. أخيرا رقد فى الرب وتلقبه الكنيسة بالثيؤلوغوس (أى الناطق بالإلهيات) بسبب عظاته اللاهوتية العميقة كما أنه يُنسب إليه القداس الغريغورى.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا. آمين.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Gregory, the Monk
The Departure of St. Gregory, the Monk
نياحة القديس غريغوريوس الراهب

text.language: On this day also, St. Gregory the monk, departed. This Saint was the son of pious, Christian and exceedingly rich parents from one of the cities of Upper Egypt. They cared greatly to teach him every virtue. They educated him in the art of speaking, medicine and also the Church subjects. Later on, they took him to the father Abba Isaac, bishop of their parish who ordained him a deacon.

On this day also, St. Gregory the monk, departed. This Saint was the son of pious, Christian and exceedingly rich parents from one of the cities of Upper Egypt. They cared greatly to teach him every virtue. They educated him in the art of speaking, medicine and also the Church subjects. Later on, they took him to the father Abba Isaac, bishop of their parish who ordained him a deacon.

وفيه أيضاً تنيح القديس غريغوريوس الراهب. هذا القديس كان من بلاد الصعيد وقد وُلد من أبوين مسيحيين من ذوى الثروة ، فأدباه بكل أدب وعلماه علوم الفصاحة والطب ثم ثقفاه فى علوم الكنيسة. وبعد ذلك قدماه للأب الاسقف الأنبا إسحق أسقف الإيبارشية فرسمه شماساً.

He was inclined to solitary life since his young age. He used to pay many visits to Abba Pachomius (Pakhom), of the Koinonia. Later he became a monk under the guidance of Abba Pachomius. He advanced greatly in the way of righteousness for 13 years.

He was inclined to solitary life since his young age. He used to pay many visits to Abba Pachomius (Pakhom), of the Koinonia. Later he became a monk under the guidance of Abba Pachomius. He advanced greatly in the way of righteousness for 13 years.
ومنذ حداثته كان يميل إلى الوحدة لذلك كان يداوم على زيارة القديس باخوميوس أب الشركة. وبعد قليل ترهب عند القديس باخوميوس وسار فى طريق الفضيلة شوطاً بعيداً لمدة ثلاث عشرة سنة .

When Saint Macarius, the Alexandrian, came to visit the Cenobitic monasteries, Gregory asked St. Pachomius to permit him to go back with St. Macarius to the mount of Kellia (Qualali, the Cells). He dwelt with St. Macarius for two years. Later on he took the permission of St. Macarius and dug out a small cave for himself in the mountain where he dwelt for seven years. He used to visit St. Macarius twice a year, on the feasts of the Nativity of our Lord and on His Holy Resurrection, to consult him in his spiritual fight.

When Saint Macarius, the Alexandrian, came to visit the Cenobitic monasteries, Gregory asked St. Pachomius to permit him to go back with St. Macarius to the mount of Kellia (Qualali, the Cells). He dwelt with St. Macarius for two years. Later on he took the permission of St. Macarius and dug out a small cave for himself in the mountain where he dwelt for seven years. He used to visit St. Macarius twice a year, on the feasts of the Nativity of our Lord and on His Holy Resurrection, to consult him in his spiritual fight.

بعد ذلك جاء القديس مكاريوس الإسكندرى لزيارة الأديرة الباخومية وعند رجوعه طلب منه الراهب غريغوريوس أن يمضى معه إلى جبل القلالى فمكث هناك سنتين. وبعد ذلك استأذن من القديس مكاريوس وحفر لنفسه مغارة فى الجبل مكث فيها سبع سنين. وكان يزور القديس مكاريوس مرتين فى السنة فى عيدى الميلاد والقيامة.

When he completed his good strife, the angel of the Lord informed him that after three days he would depart from the world. St. Gregory called the elders of the desert, bade them farewell then departed in peace on the third day.

When he completed his good strife, the angel of the Lord informed him that after three days he would depart from the world. St. Gregory called the elders of the desert, bade them farewell then departed in peace on the third day.
ولما أكمل جهاده الحسن أعلمه ملاك الرب بإنتقاله بعد ثلاثة أيام فدعا شيوخ البرية فودعهم وتنيح بسلام في اليوم الثالث.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Twenty-Fifth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Twenty-Fifth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الخامس والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the twenty-fifth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the twenty-fifth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الخامس والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Departure of Jonah, the Great Prophet
The Departure of Jonah, the Great Prophet
نياحة يونان النبى

text.language: On this day, the prophet Jonah, the son of Amittai, from the tribe of Zebulun, departed. He was from Gath Hepher a town nearby Nazareth of Galilee. He was during the reign of Jeroboam II, king of Israel who reigned from 783 to 743 B.C. According to the Jewish tradition, he was the son of the widow of Zar-e-phath whom Elijah the Prophet had risen from the dead . The name Jonah derived from the original Hebrew word Yona which means “dove”.

On this day, the prophet Jonah, the son of Amittai, from the tribe of Zebulun, departed. He was from Gath Hepher a town nearby Nazareth of Galilee. He was during the reign of Jeroboam II, king of Israel who reigned from 783 to 743 B.C. According to the Jewish tradition, he was the son of the widow of Zar-e-phath whom Elijah the Prophet had risen from the dead . The name Jonah derived from the original Hebrew word Yona which means “dove”.

فى مثل هذا اليوم تنيح النبى يونان بن أمتاى من سبط زبولون وهو من جت حافر بالقرب من الناصرة بالجليل. وكان فى أيام يربعام الثانى ملك إسرائيل الذى مَلك بين 783-743 ق.م. ويقول عنه تقليد اليهود أنه إبن أرملة صرفة صيدا الذى أقامه إيليا النبى من الموت (1مل 17 :17 - 24). وكلمه يونان في الأصل العبرى (يونا) ومعناها (حمامة).

God ordered him to go to the city of Nineveh in Iraq. The Lord asked him to cry out to its people to repent and to return to God for their wickedness has come up to heaven. Jonah disobeyed the order of God, so he arose to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord, in a ship. But the Lord sent out a great wind on the sea, and there was a mighty tempest … and the ship was about to be broken up. Those who were in the ship were afraid; and every man cried out to his god, and threw the cargo that was in the ship into the sea. But Jonah had gone down into the lowest parts of the ship, had lain down, and was fast asleep. So the captain came to him, and said to him, “What do you mean, sleeper? Arise, call on your God; perhaps your God will consider us, so that we may not perish.” And they said to one another, “Come, and let us cast lots that we may know for whose cause this trouble has come upon us.” So they cast lots and the lot fell on Jonah.

God ordered him to go to the city of Nineveh in Iraq. The Lord asked him to cry out to its people to repent and to return to God for their wickedness has come up to heaven. Jonah disobeyed the order of God, so he arose to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord, in a ship. But the Lord sent out a great wind on the sea, and there was a mighty tempest … and the ship was about to be broken up. Those who were in the ship were afraid; and every man cried out to his god, and threw the cargo that was in the ship into the sea. But Jonah had gone down into the lowest parts of the ship, had lain down, and was fast asleep. So the captain came to him, and said to him, “What do you mean, sleeper? Arise, call on your God; perhaps your God will consider us, so that we may not perish.” And they said to one another, “Come, and let us cast lots that we may know for whose cause this trouble has come upon us.” So they cast lots and the lot fell on Jonah.

وقد أمره الله أن يمضى إلى مدينة نينوى (تقوم الآن مدينة الموصل بالعراق مكان مدينة نينوى القديمة) بالعراق وينادى أهلها ليتوبوا ويرجعوا إلى الله إذ صعد شرهم إلى السماء. ولكنه خالف أمر الله فقام وهرب إلى ترشيش (هى ترتيسوس وتقع جنوب أسبانيا قرب جبل طارق ) فى سفينة، فهاج البحر حتى كادت السفينة تغرق فخاف كل من بالسفينة وطرحوا الأمتعة فى البحر وصرخوا كل واحد إلى إلهه أما يونان فكان قد نزل إلى جوف السفينة ونام نوماً عميقاً. فجاء إليه رئيس النوتية وأيقظه قائلا: لماذا تنام قم أصرخ إلى إلهك لئلا نهلك ثم ألقوا قرعة ليعرفوا بسبب من هذه البلية فوقعت على يونان.
Then they said to him, “Tell us … of what people are you?” He said to them, “I am a Hebrew; fleeing from the presence of the Lord.”
Then they said to him, “Tell us … of what people are you?” He said to them, “I am a Hebrew; fleeing from the presence of the Lord.”
ولما سألوه قال :(أنا عبرانى هارب من وجه الله).

Then they said to him, “What shall we do to you that the sea may be calm for us?” And he said to them, “Pick me up and threw me into the sea; then the sea will become calm for you. For I know that this great tempest is because of me.” So they picked up Jonah and threw him into the sea, and the sea ceased immediately from its raging.

Then they said to him, “What shall we do to you that the sea may be calm for us?” And he said to them, “Pick me up and threw me into the sea; then the sea will become calm for you. For I know that this great tempest is because of me.” So they picked up Jonah and threw him into the sea, and the sea ceased immediately from its raging.
فقالوا له ماذا نصنع بك ليهدأ البحر ؟. فقال إلقَّونى فى البحر فيهدأ ، لأنى عالم أنه بسبى قد حدث هذا النوء العظيم. فأخذوا يونان وطرحوه فى البحر فتوقف البحر عن هيجانه في الحال.

Now the Lord had prepared a great fish to swallow Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights. Then Jonah prayed to the Lord a profound prayer in the belly of the fish (This prayer is recorded in the 2nd chapter of the book of Jonah). After this prayer the Lord accepted his repentance and; “So the Lord spoke to the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.”

Now the Lord had prepared a great fish to swallow Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights. Then Jonah prayed to the Lord a profound prayer in the belly of the fish (This prayer is recorded in the 2nd chapter of the book of Jonah). After this prayer the Lord accepted his repentance and; “So the Lord spoke to the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.”

أما الرب فأعد حوتاً عظيماً ليبتلع يونان فكان فى جوف الحوت ثلاثة أيام وثلاث ليال. وصلى يونان فى بطن الحوت صلاة عميقة (مذكورة في سفر يونان الإصحاح الثاني). وبعد هذه الصلاة قبل الرب توبته وأمر الرب الحوت فقذفه إلى البر.
Now the word of the Lord came to Jonah the second time, saying,
Now the word of the Lord came to Jonah the second time, saying,
ثم صار قول الرب إلى يونان ثانية :

“Arise, go to Nineveh … and preach to it the message that I tell you.” So Jonah arose and went to Nineveh. Then he cried out in the city and said, “Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown!” So the people of Nineveh believed God and they repented a true repentance with fasting, prayer, and submissiveness. When God saw their true repentance, He had mercy on them, forgave their sins, and took away His anger from them.

“Arise, go to Nineveh … and preach to it the message that I tell you.” So Jonah arose and went to Nineveh. Then he cried out in the city and said, “Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown!” So the people of Nineveh believed God and they repented a true repentance with fasting, prayer, and submissiveness. When God saw their true repentance, He had mercy on them, forgave their sins, and took away His anger from them.

قم أذهب إلى نينوى وناد لها بالمناداة التى أنا مكلمك بها. فقام يونان وذهب إلى نينوى ونادى فيها قائلا: بعد أربعين يوماً تنقلب نينوى. فآمن أهل نينوى بالله وتابوا توبة حقيقية بالصوم والصلاة والتذلل. فلما رأى الله توبتهم الحقيقية رحمهم وغفر خطاياهم ورفع غضبه عنهم.

Afterwards, Jonah returned to the land of Israel and lived in seclusion in a place nearby the city of Tyre in Syria. He died in a good old age of one hundred years old. He prophesied during the reign of Amaziah and Azariah kings of Judah and Jeroboam II king of Israel.

Afterwards, Jonah returned to the land of Israel and lived in seclusion in a place nearby the city of Tyre in Syria. He died in a good old age of one hundred years old. He prophesied during the reign of Amaziah and Azariah kings of Judah and Jeroboam II king of Israel.
وبعد ذلك رجع يونان إلى أرض إسرائيل وإعتزل فى مكان قريب من مدينة صور بالشام إلى أن مات وعمره حوالى مائة سنة. وتنبأ فى أيام آموص وعزيا ملوك يهوذا.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا أمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Maurice, the Leader of the Theban Legion
The Martyrdom of St. Maurice, the Leader of the Theban Legion
إستشهاد القديس موريس قائد الفرقة الطيبية

text.language: on this day also of the year 19 of the martyrs (303 A.D.) St. Maurice , the leader of the Theban Legion, was martyred. The Theban Legion had been called from Thebes in Egypt (Luxor) to the city of Agaunum to assist Maximian to defeat the revolts of the tribes of Bagaudea. The Legion was made of 6600 soldiers.

on this day also of the year 19 of the martyrs (303 A.D.) St. Maurice , the leader of the Theban Legion, was martyred. The Theban Legion had been called from Thebes in Egypt (Luxor) to the city of Agaunum to assist Maximian to defeat the revolts of the tribes of Bagaudea. The Legion was made of 6600 soldiers.

وفيه أيضاً من سنة 19 للشهداء (303 م) إستشهد القديس موريس قائد الفرقة الطيبية التى إنتقلت من طيبة إلى مدينة أجانوم (مدينة بسويسرا حالياً هى مدينة سان موريس بمقاطعة الفاليس) لإخماد ثورات قبائل الباجود وكان عددها 6600 جندياً.

Maximian was then residing in a near-by city called Octudurum , and he ordered the commander Maurice and the member of the Legion to offer sacrifices to the gods before engaging in the war. They all refused to obey the order. The Emperor ordered to slay every tenth soldier to force the rest of the Legion to obey his orders. Nevertheless, the rest of the Legion was more enthusiastic to adhere to the Christian faith. The Emperor was enraged and ordered to kill tenth of the rest.

Maximian was then residing in a near-by city called Octudurum , and he ordered the commander Maurice and the member of the Legion to offer sacrifices to the gods before engaging in the war. They all refused to obey the order. The Emperor ordered to slay every tenth soldier to force the rest of the Legion to obey his orders. Nevertheless, the rest of the Legion was more enthusiastic to adhere to the Christian faith. The Emperor was enraged and ordered to kill tenth of the rest.

وكان الإمبراطور مكسيميانوس يقيم حينئذ بمدينة أوكتودورم (مدينة بسويسرا حالياً هى مدينة مارتينى) فأمر القائد موريس وأعضاء الفرقة بتقديم الذبائح للآلهة قبل الهجوم ، فرفضوا جميعاً إطاعة الأمر فأمر الإمبراطور بقتل عُشر الفرقة لإرغام بقيتها على طاعته. وعند ذلك تزايد حماس بقية الفرقة للتمسك بالإيمان المسيحى. فغضب الإمبراطور أكثر وأمر بقتل عُشر المتبقيين.

St. Maurice encouraged the members of the Legion to steadfast in the faith along with declaring their military loyalty to the Emperor. The Emperor became furious and ordered to eliminate the rest of the unit present around Agaunum, and to pursue the rest of the units of the Theban Legion in their positions in Switzerland, Italy and Germany.

St. Maurice encouraged the members of the Legion to steadfast in the faith along with declaring their military loyalty to the Emperor. The Emperor became furious and ordered to eliminate the rest of the unit present around Agaunum, and to pursue the rest of the units of the Theban Legion in their positions in Switzerland, Italy and Germany.

وكان القديس موريس يشجع الجنود على التمسك بايمانهم مع إعلان ولائهم للإمبراطور. إزداد الإمبراطور هياجاً وأمر بإبادة الكتيبة الموجودة بأوجانوم والقيام بتعقب بقية كتائب الفرقة الطيبية فى مواقعهم بسويسرا و إيطاليا وألمانيا.

St. Maurice received the crown of martyrdom along with the unit that was in Agaunum which numbered 520 soldiers. The Lord had performed many miracles from his pure body that many of the people of these places believed.

St. Maurice received the crown of martyrdom along with the unit that was in Agaunum which numbered 520 soldiers. The Lord had performed many miracles from his pure body that many of the people of these places believed.
أما القديس موريس فنال إكليل الشهادة ومعه الكتيبة التى فى أوجانوم والبالغ عددهم 520 جندياً. وكان الرب يجرى العديد من المعجزات من جسده الطاهر حتى آمن عدد كبير من الشعب المتواجد بتلك النواحي.
St. Maurice is considered to be the patron saint of Switzerland. Many churches, social institutions and monasteries were built after his name.
St. Maurice is considered to be the patron saint of Switzerland. Many churches, social institutions and monasteries were built after his name.
ويعتبر القديس موريس هو شفيع بلاد سويسرا ، وبُنيت على إسمه كثير من الكنائس والمؤسسات الاجتماعية، والأديرة.
On the 18th of Tute year 1703 of the martyrs (28th of September, 1986 A.D.), H. H. Pope Shenouda III, the 117th Patriarch, received
On the 18th of Tute year 1703 of the martyrs (28th of September, 1986 A.D.), H. H. Pope Shenouda III, the 117th Patriarch, received
وفى يوم 18 توت سنة 1703 للشهداء (28 سبتمبر 1986 م ) إستلم مثلث الرحمات قداسة البابا شنودة الثالث البطريرك المائة والسابع عشر جزءاً من رفات القديس موريس.
a part of the relics of St. Maurice which is currently located in the area of Anba Roweis, Abbasya, Cairo.
a part of the relics of St. Maurice which is currently located in the area of Anba Roweis, Abbasya, Cairo.
حيث يوجد حالياً بمنطقة الأنبا رويس بالعباسية بالقاهرة.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائما أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Twenty-Sixth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Twenty-Sixth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم السادس والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the twenty-sixth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the twenty-sixth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم السادس والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Annunciation of Zacharias the Priest with the Birth of John the Baptist
The Annunciation of Zacharias the Priest with the Birth of John the Baptist
بشارة زكريا الكاهن بميلاد يوحنا المعمدان

text.language: The holy church arranged to celebrate on this day the commemoration of the annunciation of the Archangel Gabriel to Zacharias, the priest, the birth of John the Forerunner.
The holy church arranged to celebrate on this day the commemoration of the annunciation of the Archangel Gabriel to Zacharias, the priest, the birth of John the Forerunner.
رتبت الكنيسة المقدسة أن تحتفل فى هذا اليوم بتذكار بشارة رئيس الملائكةجبرائيل للقديس زكريا بميلاد يوحنا السابق .

The Lord sent the Archangel Gabriel to announce Zacharias the priest while he was burning incense inside the temple of the Lord. And the whole multitude of the people was praying outside at the hour of the incense. And when Zacharias saw the angel, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him. But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zacharias, for your prayer is heard; and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John. And you will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth. For he will be great in the sight of the Lord … he will also be filled with the Holy Spirit; even from his mother’s womb. And he will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God. He will also go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”

The Lord sent the Archangel Gabriel to announce Zacharias the priest while he was burning incense inside the temple of the Lord. And the whole multitude of the people was praying outside at the hour of the incense. And when Zacharias saw the angel, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him. But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zacharias, for your prayer is heard; and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John. And you will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth. For he will be great in the sight of the Lord … he will also be filled with the Holy Spirit; even from his mother’s womb. And he will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God. He will also go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”

وذلك أن الله أرسل رئيس الملائكة جبرائيل إلى زكريا الكاهن بينما كان يرفع البخور داخل الهيكل. وكان جمهور الشعب خارجاً وقت البخور. فلما رأى زكريا الملاك إضطرب وخاف فقال له الملاك: " لا تخف يازكريا لأن طلبتك قد سُمعت وامرأتك أليصابات ستلد لك ابناً وتسميه يوحنا. ويكون لك فرح وإبتهاج وكثيرون سيفرحون بولادته ، لأنه يكون عظيماً أمام الرب ومن بطن أمه يمتلئ من الروح القدس ، ويرد كثيرين من بنى إسرائيل إلى الرب إلههم. ويتقدم أمامه بروح إيليا وقوته ليرد قلوب الآباء إلى الأبناء والعصاة إلى فكر الأبرار ويهيئ للرب شعباً مستعداً. (لوقا 1: 13-17).

And Zacharias said to the angel, “How shall I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years.” And the angel answered and said to him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and was sent to speak to you and bring you these glad tidings. But behold, you will be mute and not able to speak until the day these things take place, because you did not believe my words which will be fulfilled in their own time.”

And Zacharias said to the angel, “How shall I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years.” And the angel answered and said to him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and was sent to speak to you and bring you these glad tidings. But behold, you will be mute and not able to speak until the day these things take place, because you did not believe my words which will be fulfilled in their own time.”

فقال زكريا للملاك كيف أعلم هذا لأنى أنا شيخ وامرأتى متقدمة فى أيامها ؟ فأجاب الملاك وقال له : أنا جبرائيل الواقف أمام الله ، وأرسلنى الله لأبشرك بهذا ، وها أنت تكون صامتاً إلى اليوم الذى يكون فيه هذا لأنك لم تصدق كلامى الذى سيتم فى حينه (لو1 : 18 -20).
The angel of the Lord departed, and he came out and he could not speak to them. His wife Elizabeth conceived and the glad tidings of Gabriel the Archangel to Zacharias were fulfilled.
The angel of the Lord departed, and he came out and he could not speak to them. His wife Elizabeth conceived and the glad tidings of Gabriel the Archangel to Zacharias were fulfilled.
ثم مضى الملاك وخرج زكريا وهو لا يستطيع أن يتكلم. وحبلت امرأته أليصابات. وتمت بشارة رئيس الملائكة جبرائيل لزكريا الكاهن.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
بركة صلواته فلتكن معنا. ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. آمين .

Title.language: The Twenty-Seventh Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Twenty-Seventh Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم السابع والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the twenty-seventh day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the twenty-seventh day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم السابع والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Eustathius, his Two Sons and his Wife
The Martyrdom of St. Eustathius, his Two Sons and his Wife
إستشهاد القديس اسطاثيوس وزوجته وولديه

text.language: On this day, St. Eustathius, his two sons and his wife were martyred. His name at first was Blasidus and he was pagan. He was one of the ministers of the Roman Empire during the reign of Emperor Trajan (98-117 A.D.).

On this day, St. Eustathius, his two sons and his wife were martyred. His name at first was Blasidus and he was pagan. He was one of the ministers of the Roman Empire during the reign of Emperor Trajan (98-117 A.D.).
فى مثل هذا اليوم إستشهد القديس اسطاثيوس وولداه وزوجته. وكان يدعى أولاً بلاسيداس وكان وثنياً وأحد وزراء مملكة الرومان فى عهد الإمبراطور تراجان ( 98 – 11٧م).

He used to give alms and charity in abundance, and was very merciful to the poor. The Lord did not wish that his toil should be in vain. One time while he was in the desert hunting deer as his custom, he saw a figure of a cross, appeared to him and it reached up to heaven. He heard the voice of the Lord Christ calling upon him to adopt the faith.

He used to give alms and charity in abundance, and was very merciful to the poor. The Lord did not wish that his toil should be in vain. One time while he was in the desert hunting deer as his custom, he saw a figure of a cross, appeared to him and it reached up to heaven. He heard the voice of the Lord Christ calling upon him to adopt the faith.
وكان أيضاً شديد العطف على الفقراء ولم يسمح الله أن يضيع تعبه فبينما كان يصيد الغزلان كعادته رأى صليباً مرتفعاً وسمع صوت الرب يسوع يدعوه للإيمان.
When he returned to his home, he told his wife and his two sons what had happened. He went to the bishop of Rome who taught them the faith, baptized them and changed his name to Eustathius.
When he returned to his home, he told his wife and his two sons what had happened. He went to the bishop of Rome who taught them the faith, baptized them and changed his name to Eustathius.
ولما رجع إلى بيته روى لزوجته وولديه ما حدث ثم توجهوا إلى أسقف روما الذى علمهم الإيمان المسيحي وعمدهم. وفي المعمودية غير إسمه إلى إسطاثيوس.

Soon after many hardships came upon him as what befell upon Job the righteous. He lost his slaves, maidservants, and all his possessions, and he left Rome because of his poverty. On the way he lost his wife and two sons. But with the divine providence of God the lover of mankind, they found each other again, and they rejoiced greatly for their reunion.

Soon after many hardships came upon him as what befell upon Job the righteous. He lost his slaves, maidservants, and all his possessions, and he left Rome because of his poverty. On the way he lost his wife and two sons. But with the divine providence of God the lover of mankind, they found each other again, and they rejoiced greatly for their reunion.

ثم ما لبث أن حلت به نكبات متوالية مثل أيوب الصديق ففقد عبيده وجواريه وكل أمواله وخرج من روما بسبب الفقر وفى الطريق فقد زوجته وولديه وبتدبير الله محب البشر إجتمعوا معاً مرة أخرى ففرحوا بذلك فرحاً عظيماً.

When Emperor Hadrian reigned (117 A.D.) and heard about Eustathius and his family that they became Christians, he summon them. He ordered them to offer incense to the idols but they refused. He released hungry vicious beasts on them but it did not harm them. Finally he placed them in boiling oil, so they delivered up their souls in the hand of the Lord and they received the crown of martyrdom.

Title.language: The Twenty-Eighth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
The Twenty-Eighth Day of the Blessed Month of Thoout
اليوم الثامن والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك

text.language: Today is the twenty-eighth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the twenty-eighth day of the blessed month of Thoout. May God end it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم الثامن والعشرون من شهر توت المبارك، أحسن الله إنقضاؤه، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of Saints Abadir (Apater) and Era-ee (Erini), his Sister
The Martyrdom of Saints Abadir (Apater) and Era-ee (Erini), his Sister
إستشهاد القديسين أبادير وإيرائي أخته

text.language: On this day, Sts. Abadir (Apater) and Era-ee (Erini), his sister, were martyred. They were the children of Wasilides’ sister, who was a minister in the Roman Empire. They were born and raised in Antioch. Abadir was appointed Esfeh-selar, a high ranking military position in Diocletian’s army.

On this day, Sts. Abadir (Apater) and Era-ee (Erini), his sister, were martyred. They were the children of Wasilides’ sister, who was a minister in the Roman Empire. They were born and raised in Antioch. Abadir was appointed Esfeh-selar, a high ranking military position in Diocletian’s army.
فى مثل هذا اليوم إستشهد القديسان أبادير وإيرائى أخته إبنا أخت واسيليدس الوزير. وقد ولدا هذا القديسان وتربيا فى إنطاكية وكان أبادير قائداً عظيماَ فى جيش دقلديانوس.

When Diocletian renounced his faith in the Lord Christ and started to persecute the Christians, the Lord Christ appeared to Abadir in a vision at night. He asked him to go with his sister Era-ee to Egypt to receive the crown of martyrdom. His sister saw also that night the same vision.

فلما جحد دقلديانوس السيد المسيح وأضطهد المسيحيين ظهر السيد المسيح لأبادير فى رؤيا الليل وطلب منه أن يذهب مع أخته إيرائى إلى مصر لينالا هناك إكاليل الشهادة وقد رأت أخته أيضاً نفس الرؤيا في ذات الليلة.

They left joyfully to fulfill what the Lord had ordered them. They arrived to Alexandria then to Ansena where they confessed the Lord Christ before Arianus. He tortured them severely but the Lord strengthened them in the midst of these severe pains. The Lord took their souls and carried them up to eyewitness paradise and they were filled with strength and determination.

فانطلقا معاً بفرح ليتمما ما أمرهما به الرب ، ووصلا إلى الإسكندرية ومنها إلى أنصنا حيث إعترفا أمام أريانوس الوالي بالسيد المسيح فعذبهما عذابات شديدة. وكان الرب يقويهما فى وسط هذه الآلام الشديدة. وقد حُملت نفسيهما ليشاهدا الفردوس فامتلأ كل منهما قوة وثباتاً.

The governor wrote their decree and ordered to behead them so they received the crown of martyrdom. Some believers took their bodies, shrouded them and a deacon called Samuel took their bodies to his house. When the era of persecution ended, a great church was built for them.

ثم كتب الوالى قضيتهما وحكم بقطع رأسيهما فنالا إكاليل الشهادة. وقام بعض المؤمنين بتكفين جسديهما وأخذهما شماس يدعى صموئيل إلى منزله حتى إنقضاء زمن الاستشهاد حيث بنيت لهما كنيسه عظيمه.
In present time there is a church after their names in Assiut and another one in Dashlout, district of Dyriut, Assiut governorate.

Title.language: The Commemoration of the Three Major Feasts of the Lord
The Commemoration of the Three Major Feasts of the Lord
تذكار الأعياد الثلاثة السيدية الكبرى وهي البشارة والميلاد والقيامة

text.language: The church arranged a celebration on the 29th of each Coptic month to commemorate the three major feasts of the Lord: the Annunciation, Nativity, and the Resurrection of Our Savior.
The church arranged a celebration on the 29th of each Coptic month to commemorate the three major feasts of the Lord: the Annunciation, Nativity, and the Resurrection of Our Savior.
رتبت الكنيسة أن تعيد فى اليوم التاسع والعشرون من كل شهر قبطى بتذكار الأعياد السيديه الكبرى: البشارة والميلاد والقيامة.

The rites of the service are in the joyful tunes with the readings as it is mentioned in the Katameros. An exception, during the months of Tubah and Amshir, the church does not celebrate this commemoration, for they represent the law and the prophets. They also come before the month of Baramhat when the Annunciation of the birth of the Lord Christ was fulfilled.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Arbsima (Repsima), Agatha her Mother and the 72 Virgins
The Martyrdom of St. Arbsima (Repsima), Agatha her Mother and the 72 Virgins
إستشهاد القديسة أربسيما وأغاثى أمها ومن معهما

text.language: On this day also, the holy virgins Arbsima (Repsima), Agatha (Ghana) her mother and 72 virgins, were martyred during the reign of Emperor Diocletian.
On this day also, the holy virgins Arbsima (Repsima), Agatha (Ghana) her mother and 72 virgins, were martyred during the reign of Emperor Diocletian.
وفى مثل هذا اليوم إستشهدت القديسات العذارى أربسيما وأغاثى أمها وأثنتان وسبعون عذراء فى أيام الملك دقلديانوس الجاحد.

This tyrant sought out the most beautiful damsel to marry. He sent some of his councilors to every country to search for the most beautiful damsel that their sights might fall on. When they arrived nearby Rome, they entered a convent for virgins and found Saint Arbsima and none was like her in beauty. They returned to the Emperor and described her to him and he exceedingly rejoiced. He sent to the kings and governors to invite them to the wedding celebration.

This tyrant sought out the most beautiful damsel to marry. He sent some of his councilors to every country to search for the most beautiful damsel that their sights might fall on. When they arrived nearby Rome, they entered a convent for virgins and found Saint Arbsima and none was like her in beauty. They returned to the Emperor and described her to him and he exceedingly rejoiced. He sent to the kings and governors to invite them to the wedding celebration.

لما رغب هذا الطاغية أن يتزوج أجمل فتاة. فأرسل بعض معاونيه إلى جميع البلاد ليبحثوا له عن أجمل فتاة يقع نظرهم عليها. فلما وصلوا إلى نواحى روما دخلوا بيتاً للعذارى فوجدوا هذه القديسة أربسيما ولم يكن من يماثلها فى الجمال فرجعوا إلى الملك يصفونها له. ففرح جداً وأرسل يدعو الملوك والرؤساء للإحتفال بالعُرس.

When Arbsima and the virgins knew that, they wept, and left the convent fleeing, entreating the Lord Christ to help them and to keep their virginity. They fled to the country of Armenia, to the province of Tridates the king. There they dwelt in a winery in a deserted garden. One of them made glass, sold it, and with the money they bought food for all of them.

When Arbsima and the virgins knew that, they wept, and left the convent fleeing, entreating the Lord Christ to help them and to keep their virginity. They fled to the country of Armenia, to the province of Tridates the king. There they dwelt in a winery in a deserted garden. One of them made glass, sold it, and with the money they bought food for all of them.

فلما علمت أربسيما والعذارى بذلك خرجن من البيت وهن يتوسلن إلى السيد المسيح أن يعينهن ويحفظ بتوليتهن فذهبن إلى بلاد أرمينيا فى ولاية ترايداته الملك. وأقمن داخل معصرة فى أحد البساتين المهجورة وكانت واحدة منهن تصنع الزجاج وتبيعه وتحصل بثمنه قوتاً لهن جميعاً.

Diocletian asked for Arbsima, when he did not find her, he diligently searched for her. Later on, he found out that she was in the country of Armenia so he sent to Tridates the governor to look her up and to return her to him. When Tridates found her and saw her beauty, he wanted to have her for himself, but she did not let him. He brought her mother to persuade her but instead she besought her to endure patiently. She comforted her, told her that she must not forsake her true Bridegroom, the Lord Jesus Christ.

She comforted her, told her that she must not forsake her true Bridegroom, the Lord Jesus Christ.

ولما طلب دقلديانوس أربسيما فلم يجدها ، فبحث عنها كثيراً حتى عرف أنها فى بلاد أرمينيا فأرسل إلى ترايداته لكى يبحث عنها ويعيدها إليه. فلما وجدها ترايداته ورأى جمالها أراد أن يأخذها لنفسه فلم تمكنه من ذلك. فأحضر لها أمها لكى تقنعها لكنها كانت تعضدها وتوصيها بأن لا تترك عريسها الحقيقى الرب يسوع المسيح.

When he knew what her mother had done, he commanded to break her teeth and to slay her. As of Arbsima he ordered to torture her then behead her. The soldiers tied her, tore out her tongue, plucked out her eyes, and then cut her into pieces. Then Tridates ordered to slay the rest of the virgins. The soldiers killed all of them after they had tortured them severely, so they received the crowns of martyrdom.

فلما علم ترايداته بما فعلته أمها أمر بكسر أسنانها وقتلها. أما أربسيما فأمر بتعذيبها ثم بقطع رأسها. فربطها الجند وقطعوا لسانها وقلعوا عينيها ثم قطعوها إرباً إرباً. ثم أمر ترايداته بقتل بقية العذارى فقتلهن الجند بعد أن عذبوهن بعذابات أليمة فنلن جمعياً أكاليل الشهادة والحياة الأبدية.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all. Amen.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Febronia (the Coptic Nun)
The Martyrdom of St. Febronia (the Coptic Nun)
إستشهاد القديسة فيبرونيا

text.language: on this day also of the year 446 of the martyrs (750 A.D.) St. Febronia was martyred.
on this day also of the year 446 of the martyrs (750 A.D.) St. Febronia was martyred.
وفيه أيضاً من سنة 446 للشهداء ( 750 م ) أستشهدت القديسة فيبرونيا الراهبة.

That was during the papacy of Pope Khaeil (Mikhael) I, the 46th Pope of Alexandria and during the reign of Abdal al-Malik ibn-Marawan who persecuted the Christians. Abu el-Abbas fought against him, so he fled with his army to Upper Egypt. On his way he ordered to destroy the churches, the monasteries and to kill, plunder and steal their valuables.

فى عهد البابا خائيل الأول السادس والأربعين من بطاركة الكرسي المرقسى. وكان هذا البطريرك في ولاية عبد الملك بن مروان الذى كان يضطهد المسيحيين ولما هاجم أبو العباس عبد الملك بن مروان هرب بجنوده إلى الوجة القبلى وأمر بهدم الكنائس والأديرة وقتل وسلب ونهب ما فيها.

Nearby Akhmeem, there was a convent with 30 nuns dwelt in it. After they plundered the convent, they found among the nuns, one was very beautiful, called Febronia. They wanted to take her and offer her as a present to the Sultan. When she heard that, she came forward to their leader and asked him for a respite. She went to her cell and prayed to God crying asking Him to save her.

They wanted to take her and offer her as a present to the Sultan. When she heard that, she came forward to their leader and asked him for a respite. She went to her cell and prayed to God crying asking Him to save her.

وكان هناك قرب أخميم دير للراهبات به ثلاثون راهبة فدخل إليه الجنود وبعدما نهبوه وجدوا بين الراهبات راهبة بارعة الجمال تدعى فيبرونيا فأرادوا أن يأخذوها ليقدموها هدية للسلطان. فلما سمعت قولهم تقدمت إلى قائدهم وطلبت مُهلة ودخلت إلى قلايتها وصلت إلى الله باكية وطالبة الخلاص.

Soon she came up with a way out, she entreated them to leave her for her worship for a favor that she will do for them. That favor was a secret that she learned from her forefathers. It was oil that she had if any one anointed any part of the body the sword will not harm. To convince them she anointed her neck with the oil and asked the leader of the soldiers to let the strongest of them to strike her neck with all his might with his sharp sword. Once he did that the head of this chaste virgin was cut of her body and she received the crown of martyrdom.

وسرعان ما خرجت إليهم بحيلة وتوسلت إليهم أن يتركوها لعبادتها مقابل جميل تسديه إليهم تعلمته من أسلافها. وكان هذا الجميل هو زيتاً تقتنيه إذا دُهن به أى جزء من الجسم لا تعمل فيه السيوف. ولكى تقنعهم دهنت عنقها بالزيت وطلبت من القائد أن يجعل أشجع جنوده يضربها بكل قوته بسيفه الحاد. وما أن فعل ذلك حتى إنفصل رأس العذراء العفيفة عن جسدها ونالت إكليل الشهادة.

Great fear fell upon all the soldiers and in haste they left the convent leaving behind all what they had plundered. Her sisters the nuns took her pure body, shrouded her, and buried her with great veneration.

Title.language: The Commemoration of the Miracle that God Performed for St. Athanasius the Apostolic
The Commemoration of the Miracle that God Performed for St. Athanasius the Apostolic
تذكار المعجزة التي صنعها الرب مع القديس أثناسيوس الرسولى البطريرك العشرين للكرازة المرقسية

text.language: On this day the church celebrates the commemoration of the great miracle that the Lord Christ had performed for the honorable Saint Abba Athanasius, the 20th Pope of Alexandria.
On this day the church celebrates the commemoration of the great miracle that the Lord Christ had performed for the honorable Saint Abba Athanasius, the 20th Pope of Alexandria.
تحتفل الكنيسة فى هذا اليوم بتذكار المعجزة العظيمة التى صنعها الرب مع القديس العظيم أثناسيوس الرسولى البطريرك العشرين للكرازة المرقسية.

When Emperor Constantius, the son of the righteous Emperor Constantine, adopted the heretical teachings of Arius, he sent a man, called Gawargios, to Alexandria. He also sent along with him 500 horsemen and letters appointing Gawargios patriarch of Alexandria instead of Abba Athanasius the Apostolic.

When Emperor Constantius, the son of the righteous Emperor Constantine, adopted the heretical teachings of Arius, he sent a man, called Gawargios, to Alexandria. He also sent along with him 500 horsemen and letters appointing Gawargios patriarch of Alexandria instead of Abba Athanasius the Apostolic.

وذلك أن الملك قسطنطينوس إبن الملك البار قسطنطين الكبير ، لما أعتنق تعاليم أريوس الهرطوقى أرسل إلى الإسكندرية شخصاً يدعى جورجيوس ومعه خمسمائة جندى ورسائل بتعيينه بطريركاً على الإسكندرية بدلاً من القديس أثناسيوس الرسولى .

When this man arrived to the city, he preached the erroneous teachings of Arius but only a few people of the city accepted his teachings. Therefore, he killed a large number of the people of Alexandria. St. Athanasius hid himself for a period of three years. After which Pope Athanasius went to the city of Constantinople, and asked Emperor Constantius either to restore him to his See or to slay him so he would receive the crown of martyrdom and that was in the year 361 A.D.

ولما وصل هذا الرجل إلى المدينة قتل كثيرين من أهل الإسكندرية. أما القديس أثناسيوس فبقى مختفياً ثلاث سنين ثم خرج إلى القسطنطينية وطلب من الملك قسطنطينوس إما أن يرده إلى كرسيه أو يقتله لينال إكليل الشهادة وكان ذلك سنة 361م.
The Emperor ordered his men to place the saint in a small boat and to leave him in the sea without food or water or a guide. The Emperor thought that he would die of hunger or thirst or drowning.
The Emperor ordered his men to place the saint in a small boat and to leave him in the sea without food or water or a guide. The Emperor thought that he would die of hunger or thirst or drowning.
أما الملك فأمر أن يوضع القديس فى مركب صغير ويُترك فى البحر بغير خبز ولا ماء ولا مدبر للمركب ظناً منه أنه بذلك يهلك إما بالغرق أو بالجوع والعطش.

With the divine providence of God and His watchfulness, the boat sailed along smoothly and in peace as if it was carried on the wings of angels. He arrived to Alexandria three days later. When the believers heard that their shepherd had arrived, they rejoiced and went out to receive him with candles and songs of praise. Then they brought him into the church and expelled Gawargios and his followers. St. Athanasius dedicated that day as a great feast to the Lord.

ولكن بتدبير من الله وعنايته سارت المركب فى هدوء وسلام كأنها محمولة على أجنحة الملائكة إلى أن وصلت مدينة الإسكندرية فى ثالث يوم. ولما علم المؤمنون بقدومه فرحوا جداً وخرجوا إليه وإستقبلوه بالألحان والتسابيح حتى أدخلوه إلى الكنيسة وأخرجوا منها جورجيوس وأصحابه. فجعل القديس هذا اليوم عيداً عظيماً للرب الذي أنقذه من الموت فى البحر.
To whom is the glory and honor now and forever and unto the end of ages. Amen.

ولربنا المجد دائماً أبدياً. أمين.
